story:
We are two sisters from Sweden who have been singing together our whole lives. This year we started a duo consisting of a mandolin and a guitar, together with our voices harmoniously intertwined. Annie has studied music for a total of 6 years, with 3 years of jazz, her theoretical knowledge has been essential in creating what we are sharing today. And together with Julia's deep studies of mantra singing, magic is created.

When we are asked about our sound, the most common reply is folk-pop mixed with mantras. Our intention is to re-arrange our favorite sanskrit mantras into a folk-music-style rhythm and melody. Together with this we are also sharing our own versions of some favorite "conscious covers" written by for example George Harrison and Eddie Vedder. During our tour, or what ended up becoming a tour, this year we discovered the impact our music had on our audience. The reason why our tour became a tour was for this reason, after our very first gig this year in our hometown of southern Sweden, invitations to share our music came and kept coming after each time we shared. In combination with us sharing our music at different festivals, we also noticed the importance of having some kind of recorded material to display for our future audience, a way of advertising ourselves beforehand. The value of having recorded material also became evident as after each concert we were asked about the possibility of listening to us without it being live. So, here we are now! To us this is a beautiful opportunity to reach out on a broader scale, we believe in our hearts that music can act healing, and this is also the innermost intention of why we are desiring to share it. If there is any way for us help the world by spreading more love through our music, then this is what we want to do - and we are hereby asking for your support :) 

We are applying for 500 euros that will directly be given to a recording session in a good studio and as payment to the help of a few selected musicians that we believe can bring their own unique sounds to our songs. Our intention is to record an EP which is made out of the 5 songs that we have shared the most. If we do not reach this goal we still intend to record our music in the best way possible with the funds we receive. If financial support is not possible for you we would really like to encourage a sharing of our campaign on social media, networking or in any other way - we are very grateful for your support. 

An abundance of love, light and peace to you all!

story:
Ok so this is what I’m all about.

 

Firstly thank you for checking out my campaign. I massively appreciate your support. You are one of the reasons that this record will be made.

 

It’s been a little while since I released a body of work that isn't a single. My last EP Iconoclast was released a few years ago and since then I’ve been dreaming about releasing a full length record. 

 

Behind the scenes I’ve been working away, trying to find a way to realise this dream. Crowdfunding was suggested by a few different folks but I guess I was a little too proud to give it a go. However, on looking into it I realise that its a way of getting something out there to people that actually want to hear it. Although I didn’t come to this decision lightly, I’m here now and I’m asking for your help. 

 

I already know how this album will sound. I’ve written the songs and aired them on stage. I’ve demoed a few and tested them on musically minded ears. I’ve asked for feedback and it’s been good!

 

You guys will be the first to hear the finished product and throughout the promotional period I’ll be gigging up and down as I always do. I’ll also be playing your house parties too (check tier 3 to the right).

 

The music industry is a beast that is ever changing. Whether my approach is right or wrong I don’t know but I do know that I’ll be doing what I do regardless, until the end. I can’t do it alone though. I need a studio, musicians, sound engineers, producers and lots of other things that go into making a record. It’s expensive but of course worth it.

 

With your help I can get this record made and into your headphones. But this is not a one way thing. To the right you’ll see that there are lots of rewards I’ll be giving away in return for your support. I’ve tried to be as creative as possible with what’s on offer and I hope that you see something there that you want.

 

Please share my campaign with your friends.

 

Sincerely,

 

Glenn Hodge

story:
Who am I?

I have been a vocalist and educator since moving to Nashville in 2001, when I graduated from Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA. Life, as it is known to do, has taken me through amazing peaks and unexpected lows, and now I’m a divorced mom who really wants to continue to create but who doesn’t currently have the financial means to do so.

I teach part-time at several highly-regarded institutions in Nashville, including Vanderbilt University’s Blair School of Music, where I serve as Adjunct Lecturer in Vocal Jazz and as Director of the Blair Jazz Choir. I’ve been teaching at The Nashville Jazz Workshop and through my home studio for over 10 years.

This new project of jazz standards will be given life thanks to you and thanks to one of my biggest supporters, Angela Nuyens, who co-owns the Castle, a well-known studio in the Nashville area. She has graciously offered me 3 days of studio time, including the use of her engineer. She has even offered to babysit my son while I record! (She’s an angel.) I need to raise the rest of the money for the project, which will be recorded November 20-22 of this year.

How much, and where does the money go?

My goal is a minimum of $7000.

  • $4000 for the instrumentalists (piano, bass, drums, and saxophone)
  • $1000 for the mechanical licenses (I’ll be recording other people’s songs)
  • $1500 for mixing and mastering (2 big steps for any recording project)
  • $500 for photography and other marketing expenses

Perks!

I’m offering some cool perks for those who would like to receive something for their donations. Perks include:

  • Names of ALL donors will be listed on my website (and lavished with praise!)
  • Download of the album for everyone who donates $25 or more. No physical copies will be made.
  • Voice lessons
  • French tutoring (my MA is in French!)
  • Copies of charts used in the sessions
  • Chances to be with me in the studio
  • House concerts!

I hope you’ll find something that entices you!

If for some reason I don’t reach my goal, I will either go ahead and record my project and delay the release, or I will reduce the length from a full album to an EP (about 5 songs). Either way, I’m very grateful for all the help you can give.

How will this one be different?

I’ve been fortunate to record solo projects in the past, but none of them truly reflects the material that I perform and teach on a regular basis (traditional, straight-ahead jazz standards). My past projects (including “A Flower Truly Blue” and “Passage”) have garnered high praise from fans and reviewers alike, but the focus that this new album will have on traditional vocal jazz will enable me to market it more easily to jazz lovers and jazz radio, for example. This new project will serve as a collection of my “greatest hits,” songs that I’ve enjoyed singing live in jazz clubs and on stages in the US and Europe over the last 16+ years. I’ll be able to present it to my clients and students as a true reflection of what I do best.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to help financially, you can make a huge impact on my project’s success by sharing my campaign on social media (like Facebook and Twitter) or by sending an e-mail or just by spreading the word in conversation. Let your friends, family, co-workers and neighbors know, especially those who love jazz. Any help you can give is very much appreciated. Thank you!

story:
About Kable House Presents

Kable House Presents is an independent, volunteer-driven initiative that showcases national touring acts spanning a wide variety of genres and styles in an intimate, listening-room environment. The organizers rent out the Philadelphia Street seating area at York, PA's Central Market about once a month and transform it into a music venue. General admission tickets are available to the public (price point is around $15), and food and beverages are available for purchase during the shows from featured Central Market vendors.

Since we launched in September 2014, we have hosted 36 shows that attracted 3,550 attendees. At this point, we're a well-oiled machine!

Kable House Presents provides an opportunity to showcase artists from early on in their careers and help them establish an audience in southcentral Pennsylvania.

 

What It Takes to Keep It Going

Kable House Presents is currently volunteer-driven, and we have great partnerships with the production company who works on the shows; our expenses are lean. Still, ticket sales do not entirely cover the expenses, and we rely on support from arts and culture benefactors to bridge the gap.

It costs about $20,000 to host a season of 10 shows. We're looking to raise half of that through this campaign, and the rest through individual giving, corporate sponsorships, and ticket sales throughout the season. The more we raise here, the less we have to raise through more traditional means, and the more time and energy we'll have to focus on programming another great season of concerts.

 

Thanks for Being a KHP VIP

We've put together seven giving levels and the rewards include Kable House Presents swag, tickets to shows in our regular season, and admission to our first-ever local music showcase.

story:
CAMPAIGN CLOSED
We are no longer accepting new membership for 2020

This page may remain open for information only as we transition to our new website! You can find us at:

virtualdbc.org

We have closed out the perk orders and audition packet pledges and will be operating over there for the rest of the season! Thank you to the THOUSANDS who pledged to make our project idea into a functioning nonprofit organization! 

If you have pledged, you should have received our email with the website password to download your packet and get instructions for next steps. If you have not received your packet/website info, please check your spam folders, then reach out via email! Address is listed below:


info@virtualdbc.org

story:
It's me:  V. Shayne Frederick, your friendly neighborhood Jazz vocalist and pianist about town. Outside of my busy performance calendar, I've been working on finishing a record. What? A CD project? Yes! 

A CD Project!

The recording  is done. The musicians, arrangers, studios have been paid. The mastering is about to begin.  

This is NOT a fundraising campaign for a recording project. This is an invitation to share the beauty of this project, and to reserve your copy.  Also check out the other really cool perks. Be an early adopter!

Brief Performance Bio

V. Shayne Frederick is a pianist, vocalist, arranger and musical director with performances spanning two decades. He has been featured at such illustrious venues as Minton's Playhouse (Harlem,) Philadelphia Museum of Art, the Kimmel Center for the Performing Arts, the Barnes Foundation, SugarHouse Casino, The Harlem Stage, Suzanne Roberts Theater, Resorts Casino, Valley Forge Casino, Philadelphia Clef Club for Performing Arts, South Jazz Parlor, World Café Live, Kelsey’s Supper Club in Atlantic City, and the African-American Museum in Philadelphia. He has also headlined the John Coltrane Jazz Festival, Center City Jazz Festival, Lancaster Avenue Jazz & Arts Festival, Manayunk Jazz Festival (April 2019,) and the Piton International Film Festival in the Caribbean island of St. Lucia. Cited by the Broad Street Review as “one of the region’s busiest and best jazz singers,” and by All About Jazz as “one to watch” and a “shining light,” V. Shayne’s singular voice—with its dulcet texture and substantial range—has a classic appeal with a bright, innovative flair. 

Listen to my interview with MusiQology here!

Listen to my interview with Brendan McGeehan of G-Town Radio here!

The Impact

Overall costs for the project include composition arranging, studio time, musician fees, engineering fees, disc duplication, photography/graphic design. The majority of these costs have already been absorbed and paid.  The process is no joke--seriously, I'm not laughing--and we are thankfully nearing the end.  Beautiful, beautiful music has been made.

Now all I ask of you is to invest, lay back, listen, share, and enjoy. Also, stay tuned for a video!

The album will be available on printed disc (with artsy jacket!) or available via digital download, and streaming services.

Musical Personnel

V. Shayne Frederick, piano & vocals

Khary Abdul-Shaheed, drums

Nzinga Banks, arranger

Tim Brey, piano

Mollie Ducoste, arranger, voilin

Adam Faulk, piano

Paul Giess, trumpet

Matthew Jernigan, drums

Nicholas Krolak, bass

Veronica MJ, violin

Chris Oatts, clarinet

Dariel Peniazek, guitar

Gusten Rudolph, drums

Carlos Santiago, violin

William Saurman, trombone

Jeffrey Scull, guitar

Justin Sekelewski, bass

Nimrod Speaks, bass

Hiruy (Henry) Tirfe, alto saxophone

William Wright, trumpet

Risk-Free

Because the project is nearing completion, your investment has a guaranteed return, whether this funding campaign achieves its financial goal. Your investment makes it easier to get the final product out into Creation this spring.

What's left before the project is released?

Promotion. Graphic Design. Duplication. Licensing. Distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please just share your kind thoughts and words--and share this campaign!

story:
My name is Brian Clouthier and I am BESTMAN. Over the past few years I've found my musical voice writing and recording synthy pop music and with a group of talented guys, I've tried to bring that love and energy to the world.  The songs are ready, its time for the next step. I want to show you everything BESTMAN can be!

BESTMAN is my passion, plain and simple. This collection of music is incredibly special to me and it's important that these songs sound the best they can. I've tried to do everything on my own, but I've reached a point where I need help. Let's face it, I should have asked for help a while ago! Money has finally become a factor and I'm finally reaching out.

I found someone I trust with my music to take it to another level and that is a huge step! In order to get the next 3 tracks finished, I need to come up with some additional funds. It's a shame that finances are the only thing holding this back, but it's the reality. 

It's difficult to even ask and takes some pride swallowing, but I've taken this as far as I can on my own. A small amount is going to make such a difference and the gratitude I'd have for your support is truly immeasurable. It might not seem like much, but it means the world to me and not having the funds to make this a reality is a constant struggle. A small contribution is not only a way to support art, but also a way to help someone follow their dream.

 

I lucked out and found some great people to help bring these songs to life. Their fingerprints are all over the music and over time, what started as one became a band. Its an amazing feeling to connect with other musicians and an even better feeling to bring that energy to room of people.  Without them and without you, I couldn't do it. BESTMAN is best, together.

 

Greg Gaffud - - - - - - Keys

Jay Spiwak - -  Bass/Pads

Adam Bonich - - - - Drums

What do I need? $1500. There's 3 new BESTMAN songs raring to go and the summer is quickly fading. I've already put in a ton of time and money to get the songs to this point. This money is to pay for the final mixes and get these tunes shiny and ready for release. I'm hoping for a September release and I really believe this music will inspire a close out to another summer.

For your contribution, I've put together some fun, thoughtful and personal packages. I think there's a unique opportunity to not only connect with this music personally, but to get some great stuff, as well. 

 

Sometimes, its difficult just to ask. As an artist, it can be a struggle to ask for help.  The opportunity to share my music is one of the most important things in my life and your help means the world. 

If you're unable to contribute, no sweat. Please share my music and goal with others.

story:
Aliens(A), Tech(T) and Cool Music(Oh Yeah!)

A:  About 10 years ago these couple boys traveled half way around the world in pursuit of the American Dream.  Little did they know about the complete new world they are getting into, but were only super excited about their future in the country they have always dreamed of since their childhood. The Land of Opportunity and Land of endless possibilities, where your dreams do actually come true if you work for it.... (Fast Forward)

T:  'Skinny is Green' (SIG) initially was a one man band when Rav started writing and recording songs in his ancient PC and music software. The Guitar was directly plugged into an interface and everything else beside vocals was made out of mouse clicks, including the drum tracks. It took over 3 years and that's how the first album 'Dreamers' was born.  The DIY aspect of the band had already begun in this era with Rav programming on his computer to create cool electronic  synth sounds behind the guitars and drums.  Another DIY album was released on Oct of 2016 called 'Watching me'. Music Videos for the songs 'Watching me', 'End of the Day'  and 'A Better Place' followed. Besides Rav and Punit being longtime friends, the idea of Punit joining SIG on Bass didn't happen until the beginning of 2017. In fact they didn't even leave a day out , the first show they played together was Jan 1st of 2017. (yay)

Oh Yeah ! : 2017 marked major changes in sound of SIG. They  started evolving more towards EDM/DUBSTEP direction than it had before and started experimenting during live shows.  With Punit's unique way of playing bass with  experimental modern tech gadgets  and Rav's programmed Synth tracks alongside his unique vocal  and guitar abilities they started pushing their old rock sound into something very different and much more upbeat . After touring around various cities in the country they were inspired by all the amazing people from diverse backgrounds and culture whom they interacted within the touring days.They came to realize that no matter who you are are where you came from, you might look different on the outside but deep down inside we are all the same. The only holdup came from within the ones mind because you always just wanted to stay withing your comfort zone.They quickly realized that music for these guys had become much more bigger than them and much more bigger that what they had initially thought. It had taken form of a Message rather than just tunes for them. Now the goal was just not making an album but actually amplify the message to pass on for massive outreach. Rav started working his magic on his ancient computers once again............ That is that  and here we are now !! Right here on Indiegogo.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Band is  looking for total amount of $5000 for costs including Mastering, Album Art, CD Duplication & Packaging, Professional Promotion etc. Since SIG is  DIY  band they have already began recording process for songs for 'Look in Through me'.
  • Perks Include but not limited to T Shirts, CD's, Signed Posters, House Concerts and Rav's Cool Telecaster Guitar.
  • The band is already in the process of  filming a documentary  behind  making of the album which will give you an insight in the creative process the band goes through in order to create their art.  The USB containing video files along with some personalized messages and unreleased materials including pictures and some cool surprises will be mailed to you.
  • If the funding exceeds the  goal, it will be dedicated to  the additional funds for a Music Video project for one of the songs from the EP which we will  be of YOUR choice. We will host a voting competition to select the track with most votes and film a music video for it. We love sharing stories from all over the world and Music Video is one great tool for it.
  • This is a collaboration between YOU and the band.

 

Risks & Challenges

We're aware that this is a bumpy road we're riding on. Without a label and media support it's usually tough for indie bands like us to reach as many people as we would like to, even for this campaign.

In case we don't reach our goal, we might have to step down and get back to home recording and mixing, which could mean some compromise in the quality. However, we assure you that we will still get the album out anyhow with the best we've got. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything helps !! 

  • Sharing is caring!! In the current tech world scenario if you could share our campaign on any of your social media channels such as Facebook, Twitter, Link den etc. It would mean a LOT LOT to us.
  • If not you could just even tell your friends and family about our band and they can look it up on the internet. We are present in most of the social media channels and streaming services including Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat,  Sound Cloud, Google Play,Itunes and Deezer.

story:
Ebisu is the deaf japanese god of fishermen and luck. He is summoned with a loud noise and that's what this record is about : Ebisu's awake !

After recording a week-end of Jean and Manu's jamming session in Paris,
Clément FAURE-BRAC (42 The Band, H.O.Z.) assembled a 8min track,
completed with additional guitar's overdub.

From that track were recorded various remixes to complete that LP :

  • 3 by Jean in Berlin, including a featuring by Nina HAFFER recorded in St Petersburg, Russia
  • A remix by El Machetti done in Lille, France
  • A remix by Idiot Saint Crazy done in Dunkirk, France

In the end, the record has been finalized in San Francisco at the Panda Studios, remix and master with Manu's vocals by Sam PURA (The Story So Far, H.O.Z.).

The cover and recording process is now completed, we need your help to press it on vinyl (12inch LP) and promote it for reviews on the wen and magazines.

Thank you so much for your support !!

Jean and Manu

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Alexis Ann and I am pursuing a career in the music industry. 
  • This campaign will help me to reach the goals I have for myself and my career. 
  • With your help I will be able to record and produce my EP. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am needing money to pay studio and production fees. 
  • There are some exciting perks with your financial support!!
  • If my goal isn't met, I will be producing a shorter EP!

The Impact

  • I'm hoping this EP will be a stepping stone to continue to make more music.  
  • I having been dreaming about this for a long time, but I need your help to make it happen!!
  • All of your support goes to making this EP the best it can possibly be!!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family. 
  • FOLLOW and SHARE my social media accounts:
    • Facebook: @AlexisAnn
    • Instagram: @AlexisAnnmusic

Thank Y'all So Much!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Anthea Jaskirpal Kaur. Originally from Sydney, Australia, I have adopted Los Angeles as my home away from home. Since arriving in the US over 10 years ago, I have been a sponge for anything that would support me on the path of inner growth and consciousness.

Kirtan, chanting, or mantra repetition, as it's sometimes called, is one of the most effective tools I have come across to get us out of our heads and into our hearts. I have been chanting these mantras for many years now and it was fairly recently that I was bold enough to act on the inner calling to start sharing them. Never having played an instrument or sung before, it was a daunting task but with a lot of support and perseverance, this inner calling started to take over and bring me along on a magical journey of discovering hidden talents and blossoming into the musician I am today.

Along the way, I have played many concerts, yoga classes, retreats, festivals, collaborated with many musicians, even sung on other artists albums and explored other genres. And now I can’t believe I am making my very first album! 

I created this campaign to raise funds to make this album. It's near and dear to my heart as I believe these mantras need to be shared. If even one person out there can receive at least a little of the joy that I have received from chanting these mantras, then it's all worth it!

Allowing the community in to support this project not only warms my heart but it's really the only way to get this album made. Let's do this together!

Check out the full story in this uncut video!
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $8, 150 for phase one of this project. Two tracks have already been completed and this amount will help fund the remaining songs. Below is a breakdown of the costs. I have included estimates for each song and the funds needed for each. Writing, recording and mixing can cost anywhere between $1,000 and $1,500 per track. Mastering is around $200 per track.

Phase One

  • Ra Ma Da Sa - $200 for mastering
  • Sa Re Sa Sa - $200 for mastering
  • Ong Namo Guru Dev Namo - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Guru Guru Wahe Guru - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Mangala Saaj Shabad - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Long Time Sun - $1,000 (incl mastering)
  • Electronic Mantra Track - $1,500 (incl mastering)

Total - $6,800

  • CD Production - First 100 CDs - $350
  • Album Artwork/Photography - $500
  • Graphic Design and Marketing for Launch - $500

Total - $1,350

Grand Total: - $8,150

These are very conservative estimates. So I have created a stretch goal.

Stretch Goal:

  • Digital Distribution - $1,200 ($100 per month for first year)
  • Album Launch Party - $1,000

Total - $2,200

Grand Total Stretch - $10, 350

Phase Two

These are songs that have been written that I would LOVE to include on this album. So phase two is a mega stretch goal!

  • Om Namah Shivaya - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Maha Mantra (Hare Krishna) - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Ajai Alai - $1,300 (incl mastering)
  • Aad Such Jugaad Such - $1,300 (incl mastering)

Total Phase Two: $5,200

Grand Total Mega Stretch Goal: $15,550

If I don't reach my goal, the funds will go to as many songs as we can get done, so it will still be very effective.

Now What You Get!

Besides my eternal gratitude, you have access to some amazing perks! Some of those are the album of course, tickets to LA events, playing music in your yoga class or workshop, and the most exciting is sending you the first two tracks right away when you contribute. This is quite rare but I didn't want you to have to wait!

Know that with your support, getting this music out to the world is our small way of contributing to the healing on this planet and to the peace in the hearts of all those who need it most.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

You can post on social media using the Indiegogo share tools. Or think of three friends who would like this kind of music and share the campaign link with them.

Thank you beyond words for your support! Let's do this!

story:
Hi! This is Erlend from Giant Sky and Soup :)

 

Edit 28.05.2021: Dear Skyheads/friends&fol-lovers, Thank you for supporting the vinyl campaign and reaching the target with me.

The vinyl is. now. happening!!!

I will leave the campaign running for a couple more days just in case, tailored for the fashionably late. All crowdfunders get their name in the liner notes of their copy received, whilst the remaining copies (of 250) will be sold ouvert through http://giantskyband.bandcamp.com and at @glassvillemusic. Estimated delivery: september/october. The time consuming process of getting all names correctly fitted in the inlay info is the reason why I think it is smart to draw the line at 80-something contributors. This also enables us to start production sooner. This is strict pragmatism, and I hope you'll understand that I am humble and appreciative to the support you've shown. Erlend // Sky

--------

As people are asking for a vinyl edition of the new Giant Sky album, what better way to go about this than with a good'ol fashion crowdfunder? Fans get their name in the liner notes, knowing they contribute to bring decent music into the world, whilst reducing the artists financial risk. Sounds like a win-win if you ask me. 

It is kindof like a pre-order, ensuring that all contributors get their copies, and the perks involved.
If the target amount is reached within 60 days, the vinyl goes into production. If target is not reached, everyone's refunded.

This vinyl edition will include a Long Play (LP) in a gatefold cover with a 12 page inlay booklet for art and coverart. Digital download codes too. This edition will be printed in 250 copies on eco friendly recycled vinyl. We are cutting to recycled vinyl, so all copies will be unique in its color grades. Factory tells us they commonly turn out in some sort of grey-ish coloring, but it will be a surprise to all of us when it arrives. Using this method of manufacturing also results in unique copies; all of them will have different gradings of colors. Pretty cool if you ask me. Keep in mind that the campaign photo is for illustrative purposes only.

Audio mastered for vinyl by Strype Audio, Oslo -engineered by Christian Obermayer.

story:
Dear Friends,

We've dreamed up a vibrant, hopeful and celebratory new album and we’re asking for your help to get it made at what is one of the most challenging times for artists to make and share their work.
 
You can help us keep making music by pre-ordering our new album and grabbing some of the exclusive offers we’ve put together here to help us fund the recording, mixing and mastering.
 
We wanted to offer more ways of connecting with you through shared experiences at this weird, cut-off time, so as well as the album itself and various handmade items like lyrics sheets and art prints, we’re also offering online listening parties, bonus albums of unavailable elsewhere material, private live streamed gigs, specially written songs and chances for us to share the new music with you in unique and fun ways.    
 
Despite all that’s going on there’s a fire under us to get this new music out into the world – we believe it's our most honest and enlivening collection of songs yet. Thank you so much for being part of it and sticking with us on The Little Unsaid's journey - you are keeping independent music alive and we truly bloody love you for it!

 

We CANNOT WAIT to share this new music with you...
 

Love,
TLU x

 

THE ALBUM BUNDLES AVAILABLE HERE ONLY...

* Limited Edition (Only 200 available worldwide) *

Both bundles include a ticket to our private online listening party with the band, where you’ll join us for an exclusive listening party and be the first to hear the album! We’ll all gather on a Zoom call, crack open a fizzy beverage or two and listen to the album together. You can ask us things and we’ll regale you with stories of studio tantrums and how we made the funny noises etc...

 

Double CD Album Bundle £35 

The Album + Signed Print + Bonus Album of unavailable elsewhere material + Listening Party on Zoom. 

Your name will appear in the printed artwork of the new album CD package, you'll receive a signed art print, PLUS a bonus CD album of alternative versions and outtakes, only available here. Delivers one month before general release (April 2021).

---

Double Download Album Bundle £25

The Album download + Signed Print + Bonus Album of unavailable elsewhere material download + Listening Party on Zoom. 

Help us fund the creation of the new album! You’ll get downloads of the new album plus a bonus album of alternative versions and outtakes (only available here), as well as a signed art print in the post.

---

We're also offering...

Handwritten lyrics sheets, songs written for you, private online gigs, acoustic house concerts (for whenever possible!) and a special executive producer 'ALL OF IT PLEASE!' package for anyone who might be in a position to support us in this incredible way in making the best album we can possibly make.

You can also make any donation to support the project by hitting the pink 'BACK IT' button at the top of this page.

Get directly in touch with us with any questions, thoughts, concerns, fears etc at info@thelittleunsaid.com

story:
One day, I was exploring my musical tastes at a rehearsal, when the bass player turned to me and said, "You like Juicy grooves!" It was at that moment that I knew what my next album would be called:

 

JUICY.

 

I've always known, ever since I was a child singing rounds with my family, that I wanted to make people feel good with my music. You're help in funding this album means more to me than I can express in words. 

The past 2 years have been a whirlwind of inspirations, self explorations, and new friends. JUICY is a snapshot of my mind's current perspectives on love, loss, lust, confidence, sass & vulnerability. Plus it's got juicy grooves. I hope it'll be as satisfying for you to hear as it is for me to create. 

As a tween, my walls were covered in Britney Spears and Destiny's Child posters. At age 16, I got into jazz and found my own voice. I continued gathering musical influences throughout high school from good friends, crushes who made amazing mixed CD's, and old wise people like a trumpet player who wrote Ella Fitzgerald's name on a napkin and told me to listen. Today I'm heavily influenced by the stylings of Erykah Badu, Joni Mitchell, Lauryn Hill, and Betty Carter.

I always put some Olivia into everything I do, like my theme song I fit into my last Postmodern Jukebox video, and Juicy will allow my heart to explore my own creative visions.

I've always been a big dreamer. If the music is tight and the message is right, I want to light up your heart with my voice and songwriting too. That's why I'm making Juicy! 

If you've never heard me sing before, click here for a recent video I've made that shares my vibe.

 

Your support and love has meant so much to me already. In return I am able to share my gifts with the world. 

I constantly strive to be better at what I do so I can give more to audiences. I've done it for years. I've done it for free. I've done it for $50 for a 3 hour show. And I still would. 

I've learned that the people in this community of artists are such pioneers of culture, living the artist life full of unknowns so that they can create and be the voice of the people. I've also learned that the people who support artists are even bigger pioneers. They keep creativity, inspiration, hope, and community alive. 

I've had the good fortune of meeting many people after shows and it warms my heart deeply. I've become friends with fans and felt supported to the point where I have the belief in this project and myself. 

If I could make this whole album and give it to you for free, I swear I would!!! This album is going to be good, it's going to be me, it's going to be juicy. It’s cheesy but it’s 100% true. Together we can do anything.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:   

So far I'm incredibly lucky to have my team putting in their time and effort for free, knowing that I will be able to pay them back after this campaign. Right now I am making this album on friendship, trust, belief, and love! 

  • Production- $500 per track (estimated $5,000 for 10 tracks)
  • Musicians- $1,200 (studio musicians, bass, keys, guitar, drums, percussion, horns)
  • Studio time- $700 per day (estimated 2 studio days)
  • PR/Music Videos- $3,000 
  • Album manufacturing and merchandise- $2,000 
  • Mixing and mastering - $200 per track (estimated $2,000 for 10 tracks)

 

Total - $13,900

I’m aware that this is more than the goal that I’ve set to reach for this campaign. Hopefully we can overshoot the campaign goal and fund the entire project!

What You Get:

Tons of AWESOME Olivia merch!!! I hope you have so much fun scrolling through the tiers and picking your favorite products to enjoy.

My personal favorites are the tote bag which I use for groceries, the phone charger which I carry everywhere and is a life-saver, and the coffee mug because, well, I love coffee! Fun fact- the music on the coffee mug is from a song I wrote that will be on Juicy! If you read music, maybe you can guess what song it is once the album comes out ? 

I also love the T-shirt because it’s super comfy and cute, the notebook for songwriting, and the bluetooth headphones which I’ve taken with me on every tour and thoroughly enjoyed.

  • This is an "all or nothing" campaign. I'm not one to shy away from a risk!  If we don't reach our goal, we don't get any of the money and I will need to pay everyone for their time and work out of pocket. Considering the fact that I would have to take out a loan to do that, there won't be any funds to move the project forward once I've reimbursed everyone for what they've done thus far. So essentially the entire project would fall apart. But I haven't thought about that because I'm not worried. I have 100% faith that we will meet the goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share on social media, there are direct links from this page to share!
  • Follow me on my social platforms:
    • bit.ly/oliviasyoutube
    • www.instagram.com/Olivia.Kuper.Harris
    • www.twitter.com/olivia_k_harris
    • www.facebook.com/olivia.kuper.harris
    • www.oliviaharrisperforms.com (e-mailing list)

story:
The Story

Very simply, I've been writing songs for the last few years and I'm planning to record an album this Summer with your help. The timeline is tight and our personal finances to make this happen are tighter. In October, our family of four is moving overseas for a few months to lead a discipleship school in the Himalayas. For us, that means we are already reaching out to friends and family to help cover the costs associated with this trip. Now, I am looking to additionally raise funds to record this album that I've been working on for a few years. I personally think that it's all in the right timing, and that people will see the value in both. Feel free to read on and watch the video, but I want to extend my heart felt thanks for helping to make this project happen!
 

The Concept of the Album

The Garden EP is about my journey of discovering friendship with God. It's about discovering that there's a greater depth of relationship available than I thought at first. It's about discovering that the obstacles to this kind of relationship aren't on God's side, but are the ideas and beliefs that I'd chosen and believed. Truthfully, I hope people will listen to this album and it will demystify yet provoke  them to journey a little deeper into what it means to walk in friendship with Jesus.

The Cost

Project Cost: $9000

More than half of my fundraising goal will go to recording, producing, gear rentals, mixing and mastering. Also included in the cost is paying musicians and buying cds. The rest of the money is to have live videos of the live recordings. I want this project reach people more than I am trying to get income back from it, so I've chosen to hire some friends to help create live videos.

I believe in sowing seeds of investment and I encourage you to view this project as an investment opportunity.

The Pitch

Please consider making a contribution to this project, because you either believe in me, you believe in the vision, or you think our children are cute and you are in a good mood today :)

story:
Das Projekt (English version see below)

Bereits in meiner Jugend wurde meine Begeisterung für die englische Musik des 16. und 17. Jahrhunderts geweckt, die mit ihren fröhlichen Tanzsätzen, kontemplativen Pavans, mitreissenden Melodien aus der Folklore und Fantasias in kunstvoll kontrapunktischem Stil so viel Abwechslung bietet und den Hörer unmittelbar zu begeistern vermag.

Seit vier Jahren beschäftige ich mich nun schwerpunktmässig mit diesem Repertoire, dem auch meine Ende 2016 beim Label OehmsClassics erschienene Debut CD „Time stands still“ gewidmet ist. Die Aufnahme wurde von der Presse begeistert aufgenommen und war für den "Preis der deutschen Schallplattenkritik" nominiert. Durch die positive Resonanz zusätzlich motiviert, entstand der Wunsch, eine weitere CD mit Werken aus dieser Blütezeit englischer Musik zu produzieren.

Gut die Hälfte dieser CD ist William Byrd (1543-1623) gewidmet. Obwohl Byrd, der als erstes Genie der Tastenmusik gelten kann, in seiner Zeit ähnlich bedeutend und einflussreich war wie Johann Sebastian Bach im folgenden Jahrhundert, findet man von seinen Werken weit weniger CD-Aufnahmen. So gut wie gar keine Einspielungen gibt es von den Cembalowerken von William Lawes (1602 – 1645) – wunderbare Miniaturen aus der Sammlung „Musick's Handmaid“ – und Matthew Locke (1621 – 1677), dessen raffiniert gesetzte Suiten stellenweise einen sehr individuellen Stil aufweisen. Ohne Zweifel zählen auch Lawes und Locke zu den grössten Meistern ihrer Zeit, wenngleich ihre Bekanntheit eher auf ihrer Consortmusik beruht. Darüber hinaus werden auf der CD Werke von Orlando Gibbons (1583 – 1625), John Bull (1562/63 – 1628), Thomas Morley (1557/58 – 1602), John Dowland (1563 – 1626) und Henry Purcell (1659 – 1695) zu hören sein.

 

Zur Finanzierung

Das Schrumpfen des Musikmarktes und der Trend der letzten Jahre, Musik über Streaming zu konsumieren, hat dazu geführt, dass CD-Labels kaum mehr Gewinne mit dem Verkauf von CDs machen. Daher müssen in der Regel sämtliche Kosten für die Produktion (Aufnahme und Postproduktion) und Veröffentlichung einer CD (Abnahme einer bestimmten Anzahl von CDs, Vertrieb und Promotion durch das Label) vom Musiker selbst getragen werden. Insgesamt sind dies meist über 10'000 €. Ohne Finanzierungswege wie Crowdfunding ist eine CD-Produktion kaum mehr denkbar.

 

Zur Musikerin

Friederike Chylek, geboren und aufgewachsen in der Nähe von München

Studium an der Schola Cantorum Basiliensis, Basel (Diplom für Alte Musik 2005)

Auftritte als Cembalistin in verschiedenen Ländern Europas

Aufnahmen:

„Italians in London!“ mit Simon Standage, Violine (Chandos Records 2015)

„Time stands still“ (OehmsClassics 2016, OC 1864)

 

weitere Informationen zum Projekt gerne auf Anfrage

 

CD Project “From Byrd to Byrd”

Postproduction & Release

I am looking for backers to help funding my second harpsichord album “From Byrd to Byrd” which begins and ends with music by William Byrd, the most important composer of the English Renaissance.

 

Story

I have long had a particular liking of English music from the 16th and 17th century that immediately enthrals the listener with its joyful dance movements, deeply contemplative Pavans and Grounds in artful contrapunctic style. Within the last four years I have specialized in keyboard music from William Byrd to Henry Purcell. I also dedicated my first solo album „Time stands still“ (OehmsClassics) to this repertory. The recording has been well acclaimed by the critics (Early Music Review, American Record Guide, BBC Radio 3 „Record Review“) and got a “Preis der deutschen Schallplattenkritik” nomination. Motivated by this feedback I decided to produce another album with music from this “Golden Age”. More than half of this CD will be devoted to William Byrd (1543-1623). There will also be music by his contemporaries John Bull (1562/63 – 1628), John Dowland (1563 – 1626), Orlando Gibbons (1583 – 1625), Thomas Morley (1557/58 – 1602) as well as works by composers of the following generations (William Lawes (1602 – 1645), Matthew Locke (1621 – 1677) and Henry Purcell (1659 – 1695)).

It is my wish to contribute to making these great English composers be heard more often on harpsichord recordings.

story:
Our Story

Rhianna and Jake are ready to sing their faces off.  Graduates of the University of Northern Colorado Musical Theater Program, these two have a love and passion for pop, rock and R&B styles of music, and here's a chance for them to share it with everyone.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to put on this awesome show... 


As you know, there are countless costs to produce a show, and that's why we're reaching out to you. But, your donations will not be met without gracious gifts of thanks!!!  Check out the "Perks" section to find out more!


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us to spread the word on Rhianna and Jake - We Rock. Become part of our very own publicity team and share our Indie GoGo page with everyone you know! The more people that we can share our with, the more likely we'll be able to plan more shows in our future!

story:
Our Story

John Cossar is an emerging songwriter from Burgeo, Newfoundland who just turned sixty.    He has gained much recognition and support from other artists and music fans in St. John's, where he now lives.   His songs are evocative, honest, memorable.    Twice in the past year he has been funded for recording by our provincial music industry association, MusicNL.  

 

In December of 2010 we released his debut recording, a seven tune sampler titled "Heart on Fire."   A few months later, John received approval for funding of $6000 to support him in recording a full length CD.   Since February we have been in Record Time Studios in St. John's working on his songs, with support from an impressive group of local musicians including Chris Kirby, Rick Lambe, Rick Hollett and Dan Rubin.    The new recording, "Another Bridge to Burn" will be released on July 22.    We need your help in completing the funding for this project.  

The Impact

John's songs have a profound effect on those who hear them.    His honesty and skill as a songwriter combine to make his songs potent and emotionally indelible.   People who listen are often in tears, or dancing with joy.   He is a prolific composer with more than fifty original songs to his credit, and more coming all the time.     Newfoundland seems to breed amazing musicians, and John is the perfect example of this.   

 

To get his songs out to the world we need your help.    You can help us reach out across Canada, the United States and around the world.   With your help we can establish John Cossar as a songwriter with international stature and recognition.

What We Need & What You Get

We already have a commitment of $6000 from our provincial music industry association to support this project, and several hundred dollars in CD sales from the debut recording.   But we will need twice that amount to complete the recording, mixing, mastering and manufacture of the new CD and then launch it effectively.

 

We need funds for the following specific costs:

 

Musicians' fees           $4000

Studio costs                $2000

CD manufacturing       $1700

CD design & artwork   $1100

Launch event              $1200

 

If you contribute to this project you will become part of our Community of Support.  Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a copy of the new CD and will receive updates and emails from us regarding John's appearances and upcoming releases.     We will acknowledge your support (unless you wish to remain anonymous) and you will be invited to join us as a guest when John appears or performs at a nearby venue.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by joining our Street Team to help get the word out about this amazing songwriter.   When John tours we will need help with postering, bugging record stores, and making contact to promote awareness of his music.    We are particularly interested in developing touring opportunities in Britain, Europe and Australia.   If you have contacts in those areas, please let us know.

 

We can add you to our email list so you will be kept informed about future performances, and we would love to have your input about the songs and how to build our audience.

story:
Hey everybody! You might be wondering, who is Praise Report? 

 

WHO WE ARE

We are a gospel group hailing from the small town of Millington, Tennessee.  We started out as a church praise team more than 12 years ago and our pastors encouraged us to finally do something more with the talents and the anointing that God had given us. 

So, in October of 2009 we put together a two-song promotional CD for a church event and the feedback was unbelievable!  We began to wonder if we could pull off an entire CD and after much discussion, we began writing music and rehearsing.  Thus, the full-length CD entitled "Spiritual Rehabilitation" was recorded live in July 2010. 

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are still getting tremendous feedback from our first project even today and that is why we need your help. God has blessed us to write more soul-impacting music and we know it will be a blessing to you and many more!

We want to raise at least $3,000 toward the expenses associated with recording our second CD.  These expenses include studio time, CD artwork, photography and marketing/promotion, just to name a few.

We want to encourage you to support this campaign as your blessing of soul-stirring gospel music to the world. You can help change lives with the gospel of Jesus Christ. 

 

WE WANT TO BLESS YOU AS WELL!

Because we also believe in being a blessing to others, here is a run-down of what you will get for your contribution to this project:

For a $5 contribution, you will receive a personal "Thank You" on the Praise Report social networking sites.

For a $10 contribution, you will receive an autographed copy of Praise Report's debut CD, "Spiritual Rehabilitation." 

For a $25 contribution, you will receive an autographed copy of Praise Report's debut CD, plus a t-shirt bearing the unique Praise Report logo.

For a $50 contribution, your name will be listed in the "Thank You" section on the newly completed CD insert.

For a $75 contribution, you will receive the Ultimate Combo of an autographed CD, a Praise Report t-shirt AND your name listed in the "Thank You" section on the newly completed CD insert.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We want you to be a part of this effort to bless people everywhere, but if you're short on cash right now, we understand and all is not lost! 

There is more that you can do.  Please share this campaign with all of your family and friends and encourage them to support this great work!

 

Thank you and blessings to you all!

Praise Report

story:
Thank you guys for taking the time to check out our Indiegogo! For those of you who don't know, we are For The Win from San Diego, CA.

We have been working extremely hard these past couple of months on new material, shows, and merchandise. Now we are excited to announce that we will be hitting the road for a month long tour July 19th - August 17th, rolling through 20 States and even Canada.

The entire band has been saving for studio time, vehicles, and all the other expenses that acompany touring, in addition to the financial demands of every day life. 

We don't have a label backing us, or any management company. Everything we do is completely out of pocket with out regret because we want to pull through for you guys, but in this case it's not enough. With this Indiegogo we have come up with a way for you to help us out, so we can hit as many states and see as many of you as possible, while you receive something in return for your amazing contribution!

We are asking for some help from you loving fans, because without you guys we wouldn't be where we are today. You are the reason we are hitting the road, and writing new material.

Funding and Prizes "Perks".

We have come up with a funding goal of $2,000. This funding will help us cover the remaining cost of a vehicle that we have been working so hard to obtain. The bottom line is we need it to tour. We have been working our buns off and we will continue to do so until we are able to achieve our goal. With some help from you guys we can reach it and get some rad shows going in your area!

We've created some prizes or "Perks", that will hopefully bring smiles to your faces, as a small token of our appreciation to give you in return for your contributions. 

Our prizes range from:

-Downloadable Tracks

-Stickers and Photographs

-Limited Tee Shirts and Tank Tops

-Back packs

-Whole Acoustic Sets

-Songs written for you

-Acoustic Guitar

-INSTUDIO time with us

-FOOD

-FREE ADMISSION for life

-naming a song off our album, including your name on the back of our record. Check them out on the side!

 

Spread the Word.

If you cannot donate financially to our project, you can also help us out by telling a friend or family member about our goal. Checking out our music and videos is equally as important! 

Without the support of our fans, friends, and families no band would exist. Your support and approval are the driving reasons we, and many other bands, can continue to reach our goals and dreams. Spread the word, help us out. Thank you so much! STAY PITTED.

story:
Hey, we’re Elias, Eric, Aaron and Josh – also known as The City Harmonic.  We’re four worship leaders from four churches in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada who decided to become a band four years ago, and whose lives have changed radically as we travel the world and have been blessed with the opportunity to worship alongside many of you singing songs like “Manifesto”, “Mountaintop” and “Holy (Wedding Day)”. And we’re here asking for your help because we’ve reached something of a crossroads in our ministry and touring life! The fact is – we need to buy a tour bus! Here’s why:

In late 2011 our bassist, Eric Fusilier, was diagnosed with a form of Leukemia that sidelined him for 18 months while he fought for his life. During this time we pushed through together as a band and community and to support him financially and emotionally through that time. And now, having beat the cancer that nearly killed him we would love for Eric to be able to return without hesitation to the ministry he helped to start. And this is exactly what he wants too!

You see, over the past couple years we’ve played nearly 300 shows. This often meant driving through the night in our white conversion 11-seater to get there. This might sound kind of rock-and-roll but with Eric recovering from his bout with cancer, sleep is an important part of his recovery. In other words this isn’t going to work out as it is! Not to mention that with 300,000 miles on it, the van itself doesn’t have much longer to go. As married guys with kids, we’re also pretty excited at the potential for our families to be more involved in this ministry as well!

We’ve come across a tour bus that will be exactly what we need and is priced at an affordable $70,000 (for a vehicle like this – it’s an insane price). We’ve tried it and had it looked over and are very confident it will do the trick!

So we’re here asking for your help to raise a down payment of $30,000 in order to get us started!

By getting involved you’ll be making it possible for Eric to return to the band, for our ministry to continue in a financially sustainable way, and for our families to spend more time together as we do it!

What We Need & What You Get

The purchase price for the bus is a total of $70,000 of which we’re seeking to raise at least $30,000 here on IndieGoGo.  Check out some of the awesome packages below as perks you'll get when you choose to help!

UPDATE ** 09/04/13 ** BONUS PERK - Thanks for helping us reach $7,500 so soon! As a bonus we've added a HEART TRIP FOR TWO including *flights and hotels to a mutually agreed show! (only 3 available)

story:
Thank you for checking out this campaign and for helping Sierra's dream come true!


Message from Sierra:

"I'm so excited to be working on my first album!  I've set big goals for myself and am working hard to make them happen!  Thank you so much for helping me reach my dreams and goals!"

Who is Sierra?

Sierra is a 14-year-old singer/songwriter and actress who was born and raised in Texas.  She is known as “the little girl with the big voice.”  Her audience describes her songs as “pure poetry.”

Her songs range from bluesey-country to pop-country.  She performs both originals and covers.

She and her twin, Sienna, have been featured on ABC’s 20/20, Inside Edition, Anderson Cooper and Germany’s Explosív.  

Two of the top things people say to her are:

"You should be on The Voice or American Idol!"

"When are you putting out your CD?"

What's Already Done:

Here’s what Sierra has already done:

  • Written more than 8 original songs
  • Recorded instrumental tracks for 6 songs
  • Publicity Photo Shoot
  • CD cover art
  • Redesigned website

The CD is so close to being done, but we need your help to finish! :)

What Still Needs to be Done:

  • Write more original songs.  Sierra set a goal of writing a new song every 10 days.
  • Record instrumentals for the rest of the songs
  • Record the vocal tracks for all songs
  • Manufacture CDs

What are the costs of creating an album?

They add up really fast!!

  • Producer fees
  • Musician pay
  • Studio Rental
  • Mastering the CD
  • Printing the CD inserts
  • Duplication of the CD

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! :)

Here's a sample of Sierra's music.  This is a heart-wrenching song she wrote called, "Came to See Me Today."

You can see more at www.sierrabernal.com.


What will you she do with money made beyond the goal?

More studio time!  Plus, there is ALWAYS money that can be spent on marketing and promoting the album!  Thank you!  You're awesome!

story:
After years of hard work, sacrifice and preparation, Candi Carpenter is getting ready to record the album she has always dreamed of making.


Candi on stage with Vince Gill and Larry Gatlin at The Station Inn during Tin Pan South.

My name is Candi Carpenter. I came to Nashville when I was 15, and instead of going to highschool, I got my education singing in bars and honky tonks until 3:00 AM, and hanging out backstage at The Grand Ole Opry on the weekends. I've had the opportunity to tour and perform with legendary acts, and learn from watching my heroes in person. 

Thanks to the recent success of my first music video for "My Fault Too", and the amazing support of my fans at live shows, I've generated a lot of record label interest. The next step is to go into the studio to make this album!

Tell me more about the project.
I will be recording 14-16 songs and deciding on 10-12 for the album. Two of the songs that will appear on the record were co-written with Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Member, Phil Everly of The Everly Brothers. Phil will also sing harmony with me on one of the tracks. I co-wrote many of the other songs with CMA, ACM and Grammy award winning and nominated songwriters. Some of their hits include the #1 "One More Day," recorded by Diamond Rio, and the most played song of 2005, "That's What I Love About Sunday," recorded by Craig Morgan. These guys have a track record for writing hits, and I am privileged to be working with them. I also have an incredible producer and creative team behind me to give me the support and guidance necessary to make this album a success. My goal is to make this record we can all be proud of!

So, why Indiegogo?
I love my fans! I want to partner with them to make this project a reality.

What happens if we raise more than the goal?
That would be a dream! Making a record is so much more than just recording. Any additional funds raised will go toward mastering, album artwork, updated photos, a new website, a music video, social media promotion, marketing and tour support. This is not a glamorous lifestyle, and I will not be personally keeping any of the money raised. Every dime will go into taking my music to the next level.

How will my contribution help? 
Your pledges will fund the production of my first full length studio record, tentatively titled, Candi Land. Having a budget will allow me the opportunity to work with a production team I trust, and carefully record in a studio I love. We will be able to take our time, and think about the quality of the music instead of the ticking clock. Director, Justine Feldt and I will also be collaborating on a documentary about the making of the record. A small portion of the money raised will go toward renting lights, camera equipment, and other production materials neccesary for visually documenting the recording process.

The Impact:
Having the opportunity to make this record will change my life, and my career. It was also help go on tour, and hit the road to come to a town near you! Having you along for the journey means the world to me, and I can't wait to share the finished product with you. Thank you for joining the team!



What Are The Incentives?

Everyone who pledges $10.00 or more receives a digital download of my new album, a "My Fault Too" ringtone, and their name on the "thank you" section of my new website.

For $25.00 you will receive the digital download package, as well as a signed standard hard copy of the new album.

Everyone who pledges $35.00 and above receives a signed limited edition pressing of the new album, with their name in the credits! This also includes the digital download package, and other perks! 

I'm also joining forces with my friend, country music memorabilia expert, Robbie Witkowski, to offer you the opportunity to own a piece of country music history! Here's your chance to take home a Little Jimmy Dickens autographed guitar, a framed vintage Johnny Cash poster, hand written lyrics to one of your favorite hit songs, my first custom guitar, and much more.

 
 

Little Jimmy Dickens Autographed Fender Acoustic Guitar.




All of the items included in the Hall of Fame Package include:
1. Framed vintage Johnny Cash poster
2. Signed Hank Snow show contract from 1971
3. Special edition Grand Ole Opry book from 1974, signed by Bill Anderson, containing a swatch of the original red velvet Grand Ole Opry curtain.
4. Ferlin Husky's 2010 CMA Award Show laminate from Hall of Fame induction
5. Little Jimmy Dickens NWA boarding pass
6. 50th Anniversary Grand Ole Opry Program from November 11, 1975
7. Jim Reeves Souvenir Book
8. Ferlin Jusky 8 x 10
9. Patsy Cline 8 x 10
10. A piece of Ferlin Husky Enterprises stationary
11. Hank Snow hotel receipt from 1971
12. Roy Acuff Opryland Visitor Certificate
13. Grandpa Jones 50th Anniversary Grand Ole Opry Program

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools, and help us spread the word. Keep checking this page, and http://www.facebook.com/candicarpenter or updates on the record making process! I can't thank you enough for your support!

Risks & Challenges

*House concert dates are TBD by the pledgor and the booking representative but should be scheduled during the summer and fall of 2013.

*We can ship large items overseas, however, cost for international shipping should be calculated separately based on location. Please us contact us for further instructions.

The new record will not be released until the fall of 2013.

story:
Our Story



New Direction Fest is a multiple day event that will be taking place in Olympia, Washington on August 19th & 20th, 2011. It will be a space for people of the worldwide hardcore and punk community to share experiences, skills, ideas, and information about community organizing, activism, labor organizing, and other forms of radical action. This convergence will include live bands, workshops, and speakers engaged in the practical application of the radical ideas and values of hardcore punk. Through these, we hope to inspire and to mobilize one another to form a global network of resistance and a movement for radical change within the hardcore and punk community. The goal of this fest is to breathe new life into the hardcore tradition of resistance and to push our networks towards a NEW DIRECTION where we can bridge the gap between hardcore values and the application of these values through radical practice.


The Impact

We live in scary times. We are witnessing the eruption of a number of societal tensions on a global scale and it is far from clear what the results will be. Millions of people unemployed and being foreclosed and evicted from their houses; millions in prison; military conflict around the world with no end in sight; the melting of glaciers and polar ice caps along with mounting natural disasters and growing scarcity of resources exacerbated by climate change; rising racial supremacist movements; depression and trauma on a massive scale; the mass incarceration and discrimination against “non-citizens”; and the continual centralization of wealth and means of human livelihood in the hands of a small but powerful class of people. The point is not to paint a picture of a hopeless situation in which everything is falling apart and the world is ending because of some supposed inherent evil of human kind. The point is it’s increasingly obvious that the flawed systems which these problems stem from are no longer tolerable: capitalism, industrialism, representative politics, all forms of oppression. As all these various crises converge we are told we can look to our political systems for solutions, or ought to lose ourselves in some spectacular new product or substance. These answers are not going to prevent us from feeling the effects of these mounting issues.

The mounting crises prompt a need for immediate radical change in the direction of a more equitable, democratic, and free society. The lessons of history indicate that such an effort cannot be accomplished successfully as isolated cases within individual countries. The current situation requires the mobilization of afflicted people working together on a global scale for radical change.

The hardcore music community emerged in the 1980s during a time of global crisis and transition somewhat similar to the present. Through the efforts of hundreds of musicians, promoters, artists, activists, and music-lovers, a global network was created through which people resisted the onset of an oppressive social order and sought a better of life.

Through the 1990s, hardcore punk was a large player in activist movements, and was an outlet for people to express their anger towards the injustices of the world, as well as be inspired to do something to help change them. In the past decade or so, much of this momentum has unfortunately been lost, and has become a subculture based around materialism and undirected anger. This festival hopes to breathe new life into the hardcore punk tradition, and to strengthen and push our networks into a NEW DIRECTION of positive social change!

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to fundraise $5000 to help fly out international bands to provide a diverse dialogue of movements people around the world are a part of, as well as to help pay off the venue, which in itself is $1200 for the two days. If we are not able to raise enough money to fly out these bands, the fest will still go on, although without bands from outside of the United States that could provide insight for international movement building at the fest. We are trying to fundraise as much as possible outside of this website as well, through means such as benefit shows, bakesales, rummage sales, and even carwashes! We want to cost of this event to be low and accessible to everyone. 

If there is any money leftover that we have not spent to cover the cost of the fest (which is highly doubtful), it will go towards next year's New Direction Fest.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will honestly probably need more than $5000 to bring all of the bands and do all the things we would like with this fest, so there are plenty of things you can do besides donating to this site!

The most important of them of all is to SPREAD THE WORD! We want this to big and memorable.

Do a benefit show for New Direction Fest in your own town! It is an awesome way both to help raise some funds as well as spread the word simultaneously!

Are you in a band that puts the ideas of your band into practice? You can potentially play New Direction Fest!
Would you like to hold a workshop that you think would be valuable to have at the fest? Contact us!
Are you part of a community organization working towards social justice and would like to table? Contact us!
story_txt:
Our Story
New Direction Fest is a multiple day event that will be taking place in Olympia, Washington on August 19th & 20th, 2011. It will be a space for people of the worldwide hardcore and punk community to share experiences, skills, ideas, and information about community organizing, activism, labor organizing, and other forms of radical action. This convergence will include live bands, workshops, and speakers engaged in the practical application of the radical ideas and values of hardcore punk. Through these, we hope to inspire and to mobilize one another to form a global network of resistance and a movement for radical change within the hardcore and punk community. The goal of this fest is to breathe new life into the hardcore tradition of resistance and to push our networks towards a NEW DIRECTION where we can bridge the gap between hardcore values and the application of these values through radical practice.

The Impact
We live in scary times. We are  witnessing the eruption of a number 
of societal  tensions on a global  scale and it is far from clear what 
the results will be.  Millions of  people unemployed and being 
foreclosed and evicted from their  houses;  millions in prison; military
 conflict around the world with no end in   sight; the melting of 
glaciers and polar ice caps along with mounting  natural  disasters and 
growing scarcity of resources exacerbated by  climate change;  rising 
racial supremacist movements; depression and  trauma on a massive scale;
  the mass incarceration and discrimination  against “non-citizens”; and
 the  continual centralization of wealth and  means of human livelihood 
in the hands of  a small but powerful class of  people. The point is not
 to paint a picture of a  hopeless situation in  which everything is 
falling apart and the world is ending  because of  some supposed 
inherent evil of human kind. The point is it’s   increasingly obvious 
that the flawed systems which these problems stem  from are  no longer 
tolerable: capitalism, industrialism, representative  politics, all  
forms of oppression. As all these various crises  converge we are told 
we can  look to our political systems for  solutions, or ought to lose 
ourselves in some  spectacular new product  or substance. These answers 
are not going to prevent us  from feeling  the effects of these mounting
 issues.
The mounting crises prompt a need for immediate radical change in the
  direction  of a more equitable, democratic, and free society. The  
lessons of history  indicate that such an effort cannot be accomplished 
 successfully as isolated  cases within individual countries. The 
current  situation requires the  mobilization of afflicted people 
working  together on a global scale for radical  change.
The hardcore music community emerged in the 1980s during a time of  
global crisis  and transition somewhat similar to the present. Through  
the efforts of hundreds  of musicians, promoters, artists, activists,  
and music-lovers, a global network  was created through which people  
resisted the onset of an oppressive social  order and sought a better of
  life.
Through the 1990s, hardcore punk was a large player in activist movements, and was an outlet for people to express their anger towards the injustices of the world, as well as be inspired to do something to help change them. In the past decade or so, much of this momentum has unfortunately been lost, and has become a subculture based around materialism and undirected anger. This festival hopes to breathe new life into the hardcore punk tradition, and to strengthen and push our networks into a NEW DIRECTION of positive social change!

What We Need & What You GetWe are trying to fundraise $5000 to help fly out international bands to provide a diverse dialogue of movements people around the world are a part of, as well as to help pay off the venue, which in itself is $1200 for the two days. If we are not able to raise enough money to fly out these bands, the fest will still go on, although without bands from outside of the United States that could provide insight for international movement building at the fest. We are trying to fundraise as much as possible outside of this website as well, through means such as benefit shows, bakesales, rummage sales, and even carwashes! We want to cost of this event to be low and accessible to everyone. 
If there is any money leftover that we have not spent to cover the cost of the fest (which is highly doubtful), it will go towards next year's New Direction Fest.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe will honestly probably need more than $5000 to bring all of the bands and do all the things we would like with this fest, so there are plenty of things you can do besides donating to this site!The most important of them of all is to SPREAD THE WORD! We want this to big and memorable.Do a benefit show for New Direction Fest in your own town! It is an awesome way both to help raise some funds as well as spread the word simultaneously!Are you in a band that puts the ideas of your band into practice? You can potentially play New Direction Fest!Would you like to hold a workshop that you think would be valuable to have at the fest? Contact us!Are you part of a community organization working towards social justice and would like to table? Contact us!

story:
My Story

My name is Dylan Sutera, I'm 19 years old and I'm a Musician who has been writing and recording for over 7 years. I've recorded with very very budget equipment from my bedroom from the beginning. Although I have produced material that has amazed people, iit's still not as good as it could be.


Right Now I'm in the process of writing a new concept album. I've gotten 4 Songs in and I realized that I wanted this to turn out much better than my previous albums. This is where you come in =D


The Impact

I believe that I have something unique to share with the world and I haven't gotten the chance to do that up until now. you can help out by funding this project. This isn't something that needs to be done, it's something that I want to do and anyone who donates will be rewarded.


it's not like I'm starting with anything.. I have a 50 dollar interface and a stage mic to do ALL of my music on it's been hard but I love it and wouldn't trade it for the world


What I Need & What You Get

I need new equipment to make this album come out amazing.

all of this equipment will help extensively with recording more albums as well as touring in the future.


Recording interface.

PreSonus FireStudio -$500

http://pro-audio.musiciansfriend.com/product/PreSonus-FireStudio-Project-Recording-Interface?sku=241723#used


New Mics-

2 Audio-Technica AT8033 microphones -$400

http://pro-audio.musiciansfriend.com/product/Audio-Technica-AT8033-Cardioid-Condenser-Microphone?sku=275056


Shure sm57 - $100

http://pro-audio.musiciansfriend.com/product/Shure-SM57-InstrumentVocal-Microphone?sku=270102


A blue Vocal Mic -$300

http://pro-audio.musiciansfriend.com/product/Blue-Bluebird-Large-Diaphragm-Cardioid-Condenser-Microphone?sku=279013


Sound dampening accesories

Vocal isolation foam $100

http://accessories.musiciansfriend.com/product/Primacoustic-VoxGuard-Microphone-Isolation-Panel?sku=430579


Room dampening foam package $60

http://accessories.musiciansfriend.com/product/Auralex-Studiofoam-Designer-Kit?sku=422602


An amp (I don't have one right now)

Randall RX120RH head with RX412 cab - $500

http://guitars.musiciansfriend.com/product/Randall-RX120RH-and-RX412-Half-Stack?sku=481735


Plus a few hundred dollars worth of cables, adapters, shipping etc. 

the total comes out to just over $2500 dollars after calculating all the bits and pieces.


It will then cost another $1000 or more for printing of the first 1000 CD's and submission to online retailers such as CDbaby.com, iTunes and amazon.


The futher $2000 will go towards Future printings of this album and many more to come as well as merchandise, and a possible release party/concert for all who contribute and of course feeding and clothing me while recording the album.


Everyone who donates will get something; check out the perks

Regardless of what I raise, the album will still be recorded and the perks will still apply for those who donate. This money is not going to waste I will use every cent of it for my music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help out with money than help out by spreading the word and posting this everywhere you can!

story:
After gracing the Broadway stage, Moya Angela is stepping out to premiere her band "Moya and The Twisted Soulz". Their eclectic sound is a mix of country, pop, rock with a touch of soul. Musically, Moya is influenced by the power and intensity of Celine Dion, the soul and connection of Adele, and the energy and dynamics of Kelly Clarkson. 

The group features musical director Steven Jamail and his team of talented musicians as well background vocalists Nicole Weiss,Jessica Luster, and Corey Johnson. By blending classic R&B, Pop and soul, you'll never want to stop listening to this explosive and addicting new group.

 This event will only be possible with your help.  We are seeking contributions to directly cover costs of the venue rental, musicians, rehearsal space, and any necessary expenses to provide an incredible debut event.

You would not only be investing in this specific concert but in Moya Angela as an artist.  If you witnessed the beginning of Moya’s career in Dreamgirls, you know this woman has something special!

If you can’t contribute today – please share your love of Moya Angela and Twisted Soulz with anyone in your life who loves music – they will thank you!
