story:
UPDATE:  

Thanks to you fantastic human beings, we've hit our goal!!!  We can't thank you enough!  We're so grateful to our family, friends and supporters and look forward to being able to take the next step!  You guys rock!  And now for the stretch goal!


STRETCH GOAL: 

Now that we've hit our mark we'd like to push through strong all the way to the end!  We're going for another $1000 in order to be able to press up vinyl!  This will cover the cost of 500 7" records and anyone who contributes at least $10 will receive one for free! (Keep in mind, there is a 5 month turn around for vinyl) Let's take this thing all the way!

_____________________________________________________________________________


First off, thank YOU for stopping by!  Yep.  You.  You're awesome. Just by visiting this page, you've taken a step towards something positive and constructive in the universe and these days, that's an accomplishment all on it's own.  The album we are currently trying to release is,

    

"Welcome to the World of..." 


...and it is nothing short of a labor of love for everyone involved.  The album was produced entirely by the very talented DJ & Beat-smith, "DJ Inform" giving it a consistent, soulful & head-noddin-sonic-vibe from start to finish.  And to compliment his audible arrangements is the young and lyrically gifted Emcee known as, "KAUS."  On this record they compliment each other's unique styles perfectly and what you get is a beautifully executed collection of songs that any hip-hop head or real music listener will appreciate...

WHERE YOU COME IN:

          Unfortunately these days it is not easy making a living as a musician regardless of how much talent you have.  DJ Inform and Kaus have poured their hearts, souls, blood, sweat, AND wallets into this record and now they have it completed and ready to be pressed up.  With your donation that final step can become a reality and the world can finally enjoy this carefully crafted album.  With $2,500 they can cover the cost of manufacturing 1,000 hard copies and then have a small amount to use towards making t-shirts, flyers, posters, stickers, etc. 

Donate today and also receive any number of awesome perks they have come up with that you can receive when you give even as little as a $1! 

You can visit https://soundcloud.com/kaus-and-inform to hear the first two singles off of the album, get a peek at the b-sides, and of course keep up to date with new releases and upcoming projects!

You can also Visit https://soundcloud.com/kausmusic or https://soundcloud.com/djinform for more tunes from each of them!

For more information please view the video above or feel free to shoot us an email with any questions or concerns you may have at: kausandinform@gmail.com

Thank you once again for taking the time to check out our page and please spread the word!

story:
Une maman qui chante!

C'est après la naissance de mon deuxième enfant et parce que tout n'a pas été facile, que j’ai réalisé qu’il manquait quelque chose d’important pour les parents et enfants de familles avides de vivre pleinement les si tendres moments de l'enfance de nos enfants.

Mes expériences professionnelles acquises dans le monde des médias et de l’enseignement ainsi que mon vécu de maman m’ont conduites à créer des événements pour aider les parents à être parents (Cafés de parents, émissions télévisées). 

VOICI LE PREMIER CLIP : "Papa Maman" avec la voix de Lilian Thuram


Parce que j'ai besoin de partager toujours plus, les chansons de ce projet "Toujours là", me sont arrivées comme des cadeaux. En me promenant sur mon vélo, en faisant mes courses, il y a tout à coup un moment où paroles et mélodies me prennent et le besoin de m'enregistrer s'impose. Ainsi sont nées:  "Papa maman", "Chérir un enfant", "Le tour de la terre", "Les décideurs de demain", "Le respect". D'autres chansons me sont venues dans mon quotidien avec mes garçons comme: "chéri d'amour", "toujours là pour toi", "Je sens ton amour".

Voici quelques extraits de chansons:







C'est un projet sorti droit de mon coeur et c'est grâce à de nombreux événements et rencontres (Marcelo Garcimartin, Denis Margadant, Yvan Bing et tous les musiciens et fabuleuses personnes qui ont suivi) qu'il sort de mon coeur pour devenir le projet "Toujours là !".

Aujourd'hui, je  fais appel à votre soutien pour en faire un véritable album!

  • Le CD va naître avec votre aide:

Le projet de CD et spectacle « Toujours là !», est composé de chansons sur la thématique de la parentalité, la théorie de l’attachement, l’importance du dialogue entre les parents leurs enfants. Ce sont des chansons porteuses d’amour et surtout d’espoir pour les adultes de demain. Mon vœu le plus cher est de faire vivre aux adultes des moments forts avec les enfants qui les entourent, de donner un spectacle à vivre et découvrir ensemble en famille.

Ce projet, comme on peut l'imaginer, nécessite un investissement considérable. Toute nouvelle dans le monde de la musique, j'ai eu la chance de travailler avec Yvan Bing, de Kitchen Studio et de merveilleux musiciens comme Yvan Baumgartner, Nicolas Hafner, Denis Margadant, Yves Marguet,  Mauricio Salamanca François Torche et de super choristes. 


En contribuant, selon vos moyens, NOUS POURRONS:

  • terminer l'enregistrement de l'album
  • payer le graphisme pour réaliser la pochette de l’album
  • presser le disque en CD
  • acheter du matériel pour créer de vrais spectacles à vivre en famille.
  • financer les clips des chansons

story:
Dear Friends, Bonjour !

My name is Vincent Lebrun. I am a Belgian musician, singer/song-writer based in Brooklyn and I also teach French.

In the past few years, I have composed many pedagogical songs to help my students learn French in a fun, efficient way. Songs to learn vocabulary, verbs and conjugations, expressions, grammar, and many different aspects of the French language. The songs are fun, varied, and feature many different styles of music.

I recorded some of them as good quality demos two years ago and used them with my students for a trial period. I received a tremendous amount of positive feedback from children, parents, and colleagues alike. Now, I want to professionally record and publish the first 50 songs, which will consist of the improved demos (revamped, re-mixed, and mastered), and all the brand new songs I recently composed.

The songs will be made available on a website for easy download, along with the lyrics, and on CD's.

Why this fund-raising campaign?

Recording studio time is extremely expensive and good musicians need to be paid.

I need as much help and support as possible to help cover those costs. I will also need funds to build the website, design and and print the CD's.

Promotion will also be costly as I plan on presenting the material at foreign language conferences around the country.

Your support is essential and I will gratefully welcome it.

The fund raising goal is set at $20,000 but we can definitely utilize more funds if we reach a higher amount.

I invite you to watch the video and to take a look at the different perks, and then choose the amount that feels right for you.

Other ways of supporting this campaign

If you can't or don't want to contribute financially but feel excited about this project, there are other ways you can help. Here are a few examples:

- Help to spread the word around and bringing people on the band wagon will be essential. Indiegogo has share tools for that purpose but you can use your own too.

- Help with the recording process. You may be or may know a musician, own a recording studio, be or know someone in the industry.

- Help with the design of the website and/or the CD covers.

- Help with pictures for the CD and website.

I am open to other ideas. :)


Thank you in advance for your help, support, and well wishes.

Sincerely,

Vincent

The songs are fun, varied, and feature many different styles of music.I recorded some of them as good quality demos two years ago and used them with my students for a trial period. I received a tremendous amount of positive feedback from children, parents, and colleagues alike. Now, I want to professionally record and publish the first 50 songs, which will consist of the improved demos (revamped, re-mixed, and mastered), and all the brand new songs I recently composed.The songs will be made available on a website for easy download, along with the lyrics, and on CD's.Why this fund-raising campaign?Recording studio time is extremely expensive and good musicians need to be paid.I need as much help and support as possible to help cover those costs. I will also need funds to build the website, design and and print the CD's.Promotion will also be costly as I plan on presenting the material at foreign language conferences around the country.Your support is essential and I will gratefully welcome it.The fund raising goal is set at $20,000 but we can definitely utilize more funds if we reach a higher amount.I invite you to watch the video and to take a look at the different perks, and then choose the amount that feels right for you.Other ways of supporting this campaignIf you can't or don't want to contribute financially but feel excited about this project, there are other ways you can help. Here are a few examples:- Help to spread the word around and bringing people on the band wagon will be essential. Indiegogo has share tools for that purpose but you can use your own too.- Help with the recording process. You may be or may know a musician, own a recording studio, be or know someone in the industry.- Help with the design of the website and/or the CD covers.- Help with pictures for the CD and website.I am open to other ideas. :)Thank you in advance for your help, support, and well wishes.Sincerely,Vincent

story:
Crooked Brothers are releasing "Thank You I'm Sorry" in Canada and Europe. Pre-order the album, or help us out in all kinds of ways.  We'll even play your living room, or take you fishing!


WHY WE'RE ASKING FOR HELP

Living a life of music can mean living through some serious up and downs, highs and lows, peaks and valleys.  There are cycles at play, and certain points in that cycle will always be difficult to deal with. With some planning though, we can see them coming, and prepare.  The possibility of opening up the album to be prepaid for by our fans would help us weather some of the financial difficulties that come with taking time off the road to create and record an album.

The year we make an album is a strange one. All of a sudden we've stopped playing concerts so that we can hole ourselves up at home to write songs, or in the studio to capture them. It is an incredibly beautiful time in our lives, but things get expensive in a big way, as we simultaneously lose the bulk of our income while we make preparations for the future.  

It makes me think of my farming friends who spend two whole seasons preparing their fields, planting their crop, tending to their crop, before finally harvesting and selling all of that beautiful food they've grown from the earth. Only then are they able to sell it, and hopefully make possible another cycle of living on the land, providing for themselves and those around them.  There's A LOT of risk involved. 

When I think of crowdfunding sites like Indiegogo, I think of community shared agriculture (CSA) models, where everyone pitches in on the front end of a project so that the costs and risks involved are shared by both the artist/farmer and the people who love what they make.  It's a community, making things together. Food. Music. 

To be sure, we'd like to tell you that this is the love of our lives. With or without your pre-order, or purchase of any of these perks, we will still make this album. We will still release it. We we still tour, and hopefully arrive in your town and play a show for you.  But being supported now, on the front end of all of this, would mean that we could jump head first into the next three years with little fear, or worry, or trepidation.  To feel the support of our community would mean strong confident strides towards our goals, instead of the halting baby steps we would surely be taking otherwise.  Either way we'll get there. We'd just prefer to do it with all of you.


HOW TO HELP

There are two ways you can help:

1) Pre-order 'Thank You I'm Sorry'

A pre-order will mean you receive a copy of the album on CD or Vinyl before the actual release date, and an enormous thank you from us.

2) You can pre-order the album AND get some fun perks, for a bigger contribution. 

Basically, this is where this whole thing gets fun.  We get to do things like MAKE YOU A MIXTAPE.  Or TAKE YOU FISHING overnight in Manitoba! Or PLAY A CONCERT IN YOUR HOUSE, for you and all of your friends.

It's actually quite often that we meet people who want to help out, who want to do more for the musicians they love than just buying their albums. Support can come in all kinds of shapes and sizes, as we've seen on tour over and over again.  Sometimes we get paid in strange currencies.  I think making a life like this work means being open to receiving all of it.  So here we are. You are the people who have made us think doing this campaign could be successful.


COSTS YOU'LL BE HELPING OFFSET

Firstly, making the album itself...

Recording, Mixing, Mastering, Equipment Rentals, Manufacturing CDs and Vinyl, Artwork, Design and Layout.

Anything we reach over and above our goal will go towards:

Getting it out there...

Mailing albums to hundreds of radio stations and festivals, publicity for the album's release. 

Getting us on tour...

Tour publicity, flights, gas mileage, shipping instruments and merchandise, accommodations on the road.

story:
MUSIC AND DANCE BANNED? On the Island of Curaçao in the Caribbean off the coast of Venezuela, slaves long ago created a form of performance called Tambú as their way of releasing negative events that may have happened during the year.   But, since it came into being, Tambú has been banned or strictly regulated by the Catholic Church and the local authorities. 

” TAMBÚ — A HIP-SHIMMYING DANCE AND GENRE NAMED AFTER ITS CENTRAL DRUM— is music of ritual (like Brazilian camdomblé and Cuban Santería), protest and partying created by African slaves and their descendants. It survived a 350-year ban in Curaçao, and is still heavily regulated there. Its beat comes from hand drum and iron percussion — often a hoe blade, used like both a bell and a scraper — and its lyrics, as in other Afro-Caribbean styles, have often held political statements, coded or not.” January 10, 2014

KiT TRADISHONAL, GLOBAL AMBASSADORS FOR TAMBÚ.  KiT stands for Kuenta I Tambú and translates to “Stories and Drums” in Papiamentu, the native language of Curaçao.  Despite censorship in their native country, they have brought Tambú rhythms to prestigious venues and festivals all over the world including the North Sea jazz Festival, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts and most recently, the South by Southwest Music Festival. 

"One of Ten New Artists You Need to Know..."  

  January 24, 2014

HELP LA COMMONS BRING KiT TRADISHONAL AND TAMBÚ TO L.A. FOR THE FIRST TIME. Through these rising stars, we will expose new audiences to a rich cultural tradition and the important stories it tells.  At LA Commons, we are passionate about using the power of art and culture to share compelling narratives that connect people across diverse communities.  Once we heard Tambú and learned the history, we knew we had to bring it to LA.  Your contribution will enable us to connect KiT, during the three weeks they are here, with hundreds of people in Los Angeles, expanding the reach of this amazing cultural phenomenon and striking a blow against those who would mute it.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL PAY FOR WORKSHOPS, PERFORMANCES AND PRODUCTION OF DAY OF THE ANCESTORS: FESTIVAL OF MASKS at which KiT will be the main attraction.  The fourth annual event will take place on June 29 as part of the Leimert Park Art Walk with the theme “The Secret Music of the Middle Passage.”  This Festival, and the workshops in the two months leading up to it, engages diverse community members in the traditions of the African Diaspora.  Running from noon – 8 pm, the festival features a procession and live musical performances at which traditional artists, youth groups, and diverse community members celebrate the global African village, paying homage to their shared heritage through mask-making and dance.  Hundreds of people from around Los Angeles will be part of this experience by participating in:

  • Workshops focused on Tambú and other African inpsired arts for local youth and people from around Los Angeles;
  • Three performances by KiT Tradishonal in and around Leimert Park during their 3 week stay in LA; and, 
  • A procession and other activities on June 29 in which KiT Tradishonal will be the featured performers.

HOW TO JOIN OUR CAMPAIGN  In thanks for your support, we have great premiums and experiences for you to choose from:

  • An artfully designed thank you note; 
  • Music by KiT Tradishonal
  • T-Shirts that celebrate Tambú
  • Tickets to a VIP reception that includes a very special Tambú performance by KiT Tradishonal
  • And more to be announced during our campaign  

WHY SUPPORT US?  With the theme, “The Secret Music of the Middle Passage,”  our 2014 iteration of Day of the Ancestors: Festival of Masks, honors these brave souls who despite threats of persecution kept Tambú alive for hundreds of years.  So often the voices of those Africans forceably taken from their home was silenced but through Tambú, music provided and continues to provide a voice for all those lost in the middle passage.  We hope you will join us in supporting KiT and making our Festival of Masks a celebration worthy of the courageous Ancestors who kept the music alive!  LA Commons:

  • works with young people to unleash their stories and creativity through public art;
  • animates and beautifies neighborhoods by producing dynamic installations and performances that reflect local stories and culture; 
  • promotes cultural exchanges that further understanding between the diverse communities of Los Angeles; 
  • connects with rising artists like KiT Tradishonal from all over the world to provide them with a platform for sharing their art and stories; 
  • makes it possible for people from different "worlds" to interact!

CAN'T GIVE MONEY?  You can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign and generating excitement about KiT, the music they are bringing to Los Angeles and Day of the Ancestors: Festival of Masks.  Here is a short blurb you can use or edit to post on Facebook, Twitter and other social media tools. 

Help LA Commons spread Tambú, the “banned” music of Curacao, by supporting their efforts to feature Tambú group KiT Tradishonal as part of Day of the Ancestors: Festival of Masks on June 29.

Indie Go Go has a host of tools you can use to share this description of the project.  We look forward to your assistance in making our campaign a success.

THANK YOU!

story:
British opera is world-renowned – innovative, exciting, highly professional – and it’s in a tricky place at present.  There is less work about, less opportunity for younger singers and those not quite yet in the big leagues, less funding for projects, yet the industry is also known for its’ persistence and ingenuity.  Regents Opera is a leading example of both innovation and ingenuity, taking operas staged ‘in the round’ – unusual in itself – to places opera has never been heard before.  This summer, Regents Opera has already performed Mozart’s Don Giovanni in the abandoned and semi-decayed Kirklinton Hall outside Carlisle  and will next perform in a City of London church and an aircraft hangar near Ledbury, on a skeleton budget, with a cast of established and up-and-coming singers, and a small, but essential, orchestra. 

The orchestra is almost another character in any operatic performance and adds immeasurably to the experience, so you will understand why we want to have our wonderful orchestral colleagues with us for the London shows. In order to make this possible we needed to raise £2000 – a goal towards which we have so far secured £1800. With just two days to go before the first London show, we still need to find £200 (the £500 target is the minimum Indiegogo will let us list!). If you support us, you will not only be enhancing the London performances and promoting culture within the City, but also helping Regents Opera to secure further bookings and to continue providing singers with invaluable  - and increasingly-scarce - performance opportunities.  We will receive all monies donated, irrespective of meeting the higher target.

In return for your investment you will receive, in addition to our profound gratitude, acknowledgement in the London programme together with two tickets to one of the London performances, on either June 18th or 19th, and a glass of champagne in the interval to toast the Don in his own favourite tipple.

We very much hope you will be able to help and that we will have the pleasure of your company in June to see the Don receive his just deserts!

With many thanks and very best wishes,

The cast of Don Giovanni :

Don Giovanni

Mike Dewis

Leporello

Thomas Barnard

Donna Anna

Kirstin Sharpin  www.kirstinsharpin.com

Donna Elvira

Flora McIntosh  www.floramcintosh.com

Do Ottavio

David De Winter

Zerlina

Miranda Heldt  www.mirandaheldt.com

Masetto

Jamie Rock  www.jamierock.com

Il Commendatore

Gerard Delrez

story:
Howdy! My name is Mark Nelson, I'm a multi-instrumentalist specializing in the roots of American music.

I play old time tunes on the Appalachian dulcimer, fingerpicked Piedmont blues, rags and hokum on the ukulele and Hawaiian slack key guitar—yes, it does all fit together, but that’s a tale for another day. 

I’ve been invited to perform at Feile Iorras, a week-long multicultural folk festival in the tiny western Irish town of Belmullet, County Mayo.  Naturally, I want to present the best possible music—but how to find a band that is equally at home playing all of the different kinds of music comprising the great gumbo of pre-industrial American traditional music?


Well, friends, I had to look no further than my old friend and long time musical collaborator Tim Crosby, and his life and musical partner Cindy. Given our mutually far-reaching musical experiences and taste, this is the ideal band to present the best in traditional music to Irish audiences.

Tim is a wizard on the mandolin, no slouch on the fiddle, a fine flat-picker, and he can cover both Old Time and Bluegrass banjo styles. We got dubbed The Zygote Brothers after a friend said we played together like twins of different mothers. Tim is one fourth of the popular Northwest Bluegrass Band Kathy Boyd and Phoenix Rising.

Cindy and Tim harmonize as only former high school sweethearts can; their band Briarose is entering its fourth decade. Cindy’s as strong a bass player as one could wish for, sings like an angel, and always keeps a cool head. 

Old friends and good music–who could ask for a better combination? 


Why We Are Asking For Your Support?

Although we  jumped at the chance to realize our lifelong dream of performing in Ireland; the airfare of other expenses related to bringing a full band and our many instruments for such a short tour is far greater than any fees we’ll receive. As full-time musicians, Tim and I are well versed in the fine arts of losing money to play the music we love—but through the wonders of crowd funding we’d like you to share in the experience and help defray the cost of transportation. It’s almost like joining the band yourself—in fact, we are giving one lucky supporter with deep pockets the opportunity to do exactly that. 

Thank you for helping make the world safe for folk music.

What's In It For You?

Friends and fans who help support this tour at even the lowest level will receive our heartfelt thanks in the form of a gen-u-wine  e-mail suitable for framing (providing you have a virtual frame.) For those who feel more generous, we offer selections of any of our CDs, books, and even rare downloads of unreleased recordings. Learning an instrument? Part with sufficient shekels and receive a one-hour Skype lesson with Mark (Hawaiian slack key guitar, finger style ukulele or Appalachian dulcimer) or Tim (mandolin, banjo, guitar or fiddle.) Heck, drop a handful of C-notes and we’ll come play at your home or office party (some restrictions apply. Like your home or office has to be within a 100 miles of us. That’s not too unreasonable, right?) Wanna drive the van? Sure, we’ll let you do that, too. 

Here are some of groovy perks and swag you’ll get for helping us out:

  • Digital downloads of “Joke on the Puppy” Mark & Tim’s EP.
  • Your choice of any of Mark’s CDs
  • CDs from Briar Rose, Tim and Cindy’s wonderful band
  • Downloads of rare, out of print music
  • Exclusive tour swag like cheesy Irish tourist T-shirts and case stickers
  • Skype Lessons in guitar, ukulele, mandolin, banjo, fiddle or dulcimer.
  • Backstage access from the tour: photos, e-mails, even tweets!
  • A private concert.
  • And, the a grand prize: You get to drive the van! (Airfare, accommodations, tolls and meals not included. Some restrictions apply.)

The Back Story

So how did a guy from a tiny community in rural Oregon get asked to perform at a festival in the west of Ireland?

Thanks to a wonderful serendipity, that’s how. I was contacted by Glaoch an Cheoil an Irish language TV show that paired surplus and unused instruments and free musical instruction to anyone wishing to learn. 

So for the past year I’ve been teaching the dulcimer via Skype to the artistic director of Aras Inis Gluaire, an arts center in County Mayo. He even performed at the home of the Irish president!

Bringing this band to Ireland is a way to continue these lessons in person, while giving Irish audiences the opportunity to hear what “Americana” music sounded like before anyone coined the name. 

I’ve played a lot of music in my life, and worked with some outstanding musicians, but I truly believe this is the best band I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.

Many thanks for your help and support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, there is no substitute for cold cash, but won’t you help spread the word? Tell your crazy rich aunt, send an anonymous email to everyone at work, enlist the aid of a former Nigerian government minister. And do use all the snazzy little social media tools we’ve been hearing so much about lately.

Cindy’s as strong a bass player as one could wish for, sings like an angel, and always keeps a cool head. Old friends and good music–who could ask for a better combination? Why We Are Asking For Your Support?Although we  jumped at the chance to realize our lifelong dream of performing in Ireland; the airfare of other expenses related to bringing a full band and our many instruments for such a short tour is far greater than any fees we’ll receive. As full-time musicians, Tim and I are well versed in the fine arts of losing money to play the music we love—but through the wonders of crowd funding we’d like you to share in the experience and help defray the cost of transportation. It’s almost like joining the band yourself—in fact, we are giving one lucky supporter with deep pockets the opportunity to do exactly that. Thank you for helping make the world safe for folk music.What's In It For You?Friends and fans who help support this tour at even the lowest level will receive our heartfelt thanks in the form of a gen-u-wine  e-mail suitable for framing (providing you have a virtual frame.) For those who feel more generous, we offer selections of any of our CDs, books, and even rare downloads of unreleased recordings. Learning an instrument? Part with sufficient shekels and receive a one-hour Skype lesson with Mark (Hawaiian slack key guitar, finger style ukulele or Appalachian dulcimer) or Tim (mandolin, banjo, guitar or fiddle.) Heck, drop a handful of C-notes and we’ll come play at your home or office party (some restrictions apply. Like your home or office has to be within a 100 miles of us. That’s not too unreasonable, right?) Wanna drive the van? Sure, we’ll let you do that, too. Here are some of groovy perks and swag you’ll get for helping us out:

Digital downloads of “Joke on the Puppy” Mark & Tim’s EP.


Your choice of any of Mark’s CDs


CDs from Briar Rose, Tim and Cindy’s wonderful band


Downloads of rare, out of print music


Exclusive tour swag like cheesy Irish tourist T-shirts and case stickers


Skype Lessons in guitar, ukulele, mandolin, banjo, fiddle or dulcimer.


Backstage access from the tour: photos, e-mails, even tweets!


A private concert.

And, the a grand prize: You get to drive the van! (Airfare, accommodations, tolls and meals not included. Some restrictions apply.)
The Back StorySo how did a guy from a tiny community in rural Oregon get asked to perform at a festival in the west of Ireland?Thanks to a wonderful serendipity, that’s how. I was contacted by Glaoch an Cheoil an Irish language TV show that paired surplus and unused instruments and free musical instruction to anyone wishing to learn. So for the past year I’ve been teaching the dulcimer via Skype to the artistic director of Aras Inis Gluaire, an arts center in County Mayo. He even performed at the home of the Irish president!Bringing this band to Ireland is a way to continue these lessons in person, while giving Irish audiences the opportunity to hear what “Americana” music sounded like before anyone coined the name. I’ve played a lot of music in my life, and worked with some outstanding musicians, but I truly believe this is the best band I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.Many thanks for your help and support. Other Ways You Can HelpOf course, there is no substitute for cold cash, but won’t you help spread the word? Tell your crazy rich aunt, send an anonymous email to everyone at work, enlist the aid of a former Nigerian government minister. And do use all the snazzy little social media tools we’ve been hearing so much about lately.

story:
Какво предстои

Предстои 5-тия пореден Рок-фестивал, организиран от мото клуб "Калашниците". Той ще се проведе лятото 04 - 06.07.2014 в близост до София /местността Побит камък до с. Нови хан/.

Цел на фестивала

Една от целите на фестивала е благотворителна: да помогнем на малката Криси от Елин Пелин. За да се случи фестивалът е необходима помощ от ваша страна.

Какво ни е необходимо

За реализацията на мероприятието са ни нужни финансови средства, за наемане на апаратура и популяризиране на събитието в медиите.

Какво предлагаме

В отговор от наша страна предлагаме реклама по време на мероприятието, афиши и флаери в програмата на нашите медийни партньори. На мястото на събитието ще има бира, кебабчета, много рок музика на живо и много изненади.

Как ще използваме парите

С част от сумата от входа и голяма част от печалбата от кетъринга ще бъде подпомогнато лечението на Кристина Петрова на 8г.с диагноза детска церебрална парализа. В кампанията са приложени и нейните епикризи.

Как можете да ни помогнете

Основния начин по който можете да ни помогнете е като присъствате на фестивала. За целта не е необходимо да имате мотор, а добро сърце и да обичате рок музиката. Билетът за гости е само 6лв. Този билет ви осигурява присъствие за 3 дни! Ако не можете да дойдете споделете с тези, които биха могли.

story:
Songwriter. Singer. Musician.

I am a songwriter, singer and player of instruments too. I write and play music usually described as Texas Americana. I am a Houston kid who's been writing, playing and recording music for over 12 years in Austin. I have been very fortunate to play my music on all kinds of stages across the country and self-financed the release of 6 albums with various bandmates - one with Crazy Chester, two with Shawn Nelson & The Ramblers, one with Shawn Nelson & The Good Buds and two under Shawn Nelson. It's a labor of love and at this point, my life's work.

I am releasing my 7th album, "The Devils River" and I could really use your help in raising money to pay the fine folks who have helped me with the recording and those who will help me in getting the music into world's earhole.

The Funds

As with my previous releases, I have saved money from playing shows and juggling multiple part-time jobs to fund the recording of "The Devils River". However, this time I want to try something different and that's where you come in to the story.

I have already paid all the musicians who played on the album and my long-time friend, drummer and engineer, Patrick Herzfeld, opened up his brand new Signal Hill Recording Studio and co-produced, engineered and mixed the entire album, but I haven't paid him yet. I also have yet to pay the Mastering Engineer, Ben Blank, for his services and guidance throughout the project.

So beyond paying Patrick and Ben for their hard work, it takes money to promote the album to radio and press outlets. Depending on how much much we raise will determine how much we can spend on promoting the album and promotion is key. A radio promoter typically costs a few thousand dollars to promote just one song to radio and a publicist will run about the same for a 3 month promotional push to press, blogs, magazines, etc.

It's an expensive game and the ones with the most money usually are the ones you hear about, this is the reality of the music business.

The Album

This record has been a long time a coming. The majority of these songs are throw-back country songs that have been played over the years at shows and a few of them have been set closers and dance floor favorites. As I mentioned in the video, some of the newer songs like "One Foot In The Grave" really mean a lot to me as they deal with stories of folks who really embody the power of the human spirit.

I am very fortunate to call the musicians who played on the album, my friends. Every one of them are great people and they believe in the music. It's worth mentioning these fine souls:

Wayne Sutton - Electric Guitar (Sister 7, Patrice Pike, Brian Keane)
Noah Jeffries - Fiddle (Milkdrive, Jason Boland)
Will Dupuy - Vocals (South Austin Jug Band, Bruce Robison, La Tampiquena)
Morgan Thompson - Bass (John Evans, Emily Bell, Deadman)
Matt Lara - Accordion (La Tampiquena)
Fletcher Murchison - Acoustic Mandolin (La Tampiquena)
Patrick Herzfeld - Drums (Graham Wilkinson, John Evans, Emily Bell)

Music is not made alone, it's a collective vibe and spirit - these guys made it happen and I am eternally grateful!

The Rewards

As you can see to the right, there a bunch of ways you can support the funding of the album and receive unique rewards in return. One of those unique rewards is the signed limited edition poster designed by Jeff Miller. Jeff is an old friend and has designed posters over the years for big festivals and bands, like Widespread Panic. Another reward that I am excited about is the Songwriting Session. I am curious to see if any of y'all will take advantage of that one - who knows, you could write a hit. 

Whatever you choose, I appreciate your support. Here is what the poster looks like.

Your Help

I understand some of y'all just can't contribute and that's cool, but that doesn't mean you can't help. The best way you can help is by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter, etc about this campaign to your friends and folks who you think would be interested in the music.

Thank you for your support and peace to you and all your people!

Links

Website | Facebook | Twitter | YouTube | Instagram | Signal Hill Studio | Jeff Miller

story:
It's about damn time!

After 4 years of rawk, it's time to get real. That's right...t-shirts! 

We have the designs ready to go. We just need your help with funds!

How you can help

It's pretty simple-  pre-order your shirts through this campaign. 

Each shirt is $10 and we have 2 designs to choose from. Order as many as you like! They make great Christmas presents!

You also have the option to donate more, if you feel so inclined, 

What's the risk?

No risk at all! You will get your shirt(s) whether or not we we hit our goal, 

Please note: 

  • Expected shipment date is 10/13. We will keep you updated if this date changes
  • Shirt style is basic cotton unisex t-shirt
  • You cannot buy multiple "perks" in a single transaction (i.e. buying >1 shirt requires multiple transactions). Sorry for the inconvenience! 

We really appreciate your support!
THANK YOU <3

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm a ninth grader at Mountain View High school in the Wind Ensemble. I've been playing the clarinet for almost 5 years.
  • I'm trying to raise money for this huge competition in Hawaii that our band got invited to. It happens once every four years, so this is a one time only thing in my high school career.
  • If you help contribute to this trip it would make it a lot easier to pay for the overall cost. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The cost for the trip is $2500.
  • In order to help I will make meals for people. I can go over to one's house and cook an entire meal for them. As long as you provide the recipe, and all the ingredients, I will cook the meal and clean up. For each meal I will charge $50 for just dinner, and $60 with dessert. You can transfer the money into this account.
  • All the funds directly go to the bills that need to be payed for the trip each month. 

The Impact

  • Going to Hawaii will help me become a better musician because I will get more experience in music competitions.
  • Also making meals will help me develop better cooking skills than I already have.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Not everybody needs to purchase a meal, if one could spread the news around that I am willing to make a meal for someone that would be great.

story:
My Story

My name is Mandee, I'm from Connecticut, and I'm a photographer. That's the short version of the story. The longer version is this... I've been shooting bands performing live since I was 16 years old. I am now 23, and have graduated college. I have been part of a few gallery showings during my time in college, and since then. to be honest I have felt out of place in such showings among the photos of landscapes, still life, and simpler portraits. As of recent I've been feeling the need to get my photos seen in a new setting, outside of on websites for the bands that I work with. Then I remembered what my photography professor told me, "You could always put out your own book." After some thought, I feel like this is the right step forward towards expanding myself as an artist.

The Impact

I feel the title of this future book, "Mandee P.'s Rock n' Roll Diary", describes exactly what it will be. This book will feature the photos that I have been taking of different local bands over the past six years. My style of shooting comes from standing near the edge of the stage, and being in awe of the talent I have had the privilege of watching. In getting this book put together I would be able to share my photography with a completely new audience of viewers. This book will by my scene, through my eyes.


What We Need & What You Get

The goal for right now is to get the book put together, and get the first 50 copies printed. The cost of all of this to me, $4,000, that I don't have. This is where your generosity comes in. If I can't raise the funds through here, I can't put out the book. It's that simple.

To show my gratitude to those of you who take the time to give me some money to make this possible I have a range of tokens of said gratitude for you. They range from a simple "Thank you." in the final copy of the book, to signed prints, special photography session packages, and a one-on-one learning session with me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can find it in yourself to not only donate, but pass on this page to some people you know I would also be so very grateful. Thank you all so much for reading this! I hope the next time I am addressing you, it's in the "Thank you"s of the book.

story:
John Dummett (doomay) has been filing Constitutional lawsuits in several states that ask that ALL candidates PROVE they are Constitutionally eligible to be placed on the ballot, and for the Judge to reaffirm the Supreme Court RULING in Minor vs Happersett that a natural born citizen is one born in the country to 2 citizen parents of the country. NO MORE USURPERS IN OUR WHITE HOUSE! John's savings have gone to fund these efforts.

And John has a plan to restore the Constitution, Christianity and our GOD to their rightful places in our nation! He wants what YOU want, and will work for YOU, not to further a political career but to restore Reagan's Shining City on the Hill.

John isn't asking for outrageous contributions like others; just enough to go where he is needed. He holds down a 9 to 5 job with a 2 hour commute, one way, on the LA freeways each day.

Your tax dollars are paying for FBI men to watch over John at work to assure he does no campaigning at his place of employment. High tech trojans and viruses have destroyed his computers at home. His phone service has had mysterious interruptions. He has had death threats! The Obama Regime fears John, as he has been the ONLY GOP candidate who has addressed the eligibility issue. 

John is NOT a politician, but has the educational background to fix  the nation's problems if you put him in the White House. ALL the people on John's campaign are volunteers. Their pay is knowing they are working for the BEST candidate; the one that will save our nation. A Christian, Reagan, Constitutional, Conservative!

YOUR contributions will fund John's travel to speaking engagements wherever groups invite him, as well as travel to appear at hearings for his lawsuits, which are anticipated in October. John's wife Karmi has posted several videos to YouTube where you can hear and see John as he tells you where he stands on many of the issues that concern the American people.

John is the George Washington that Glenn Beck has told you 'was out there', and he has been found. Being a middle class patriot, like most of us, he could use a little financial help to continue the campaign through to the finish. The media and GOP have slammed the door in his face because he questions the eligibility of Obama. But, don't we all want the TRUTH about Obama?

John would be the president who works for you, and can relate to you. He, too, has a mortgage 'under water'. Unite behind John Dummett and we can change all this.

GOD BLESS YOU, AND GOD BLESS AMERICA!

story:
Hartford New Music Festival

The Second Annual Hartford New Music Festival will take place on May 5th, 2012 at 2pm in the historic Charter Oak Cultural Center. This year's festival features performers, composer and ensembles from Connecticut, New England, New York and beyond presenting a mixture of new work paired with modern classics. This year's festival includes:

  • The first ever HNMF Commission! This year's commission went to New Haven based singer/composer Anne Rhodes who is creating a large-scale handstitched graphic score to be performed by an ensemble
  • premeries of new works by Robert Carl, Todd Merrell and Marc Burns, along with works by Cenk Ergun, Kirsten Volness, Chris Cerrone, Feng-Hsu Lee, Jocelyn Ho, Matt Sargent, Anthony Braxton, Alvin Lucier, John Cage, Frederic Rzewski, Michel van der Aa and Hanns Eisler
  • performances by Jeffrey Kreiger, EXILKABARETT, Jessie Marino, Duo Oboe Agusto, Ensemble 016, and MANY OTHERS!
  • sound and video installations by NewMusicNewMediaNewEngland and others

The 2011 Edition of HNMF was a great success, including a great review in the Courant, as well as three packed concerts of excited audiences. Help our campaign to make this year's festival even better! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $500 to support the costs of the festival, which include the HNMF Commission Fund, venue staffing and travel stipends for out-of-town performers. This is just a percentage of the total cost of the festival, so we would love to raise even more than this!

Funders will be able to get tickets to the Festival, a HNMF poster, artist recordings, and for our largest donors, a private performance! Check below for the perks that you'd like to recieve!

Why Help?

Like many areas, arts funding in Hartford has plummeted, leaving few options for those interested in presenting and attending performances. There are no major presenters of contemporary music in the area, so events like HNMF help bring new music to audiences that might not be able to otherwise seek it out in town. By donating to this campaign, you can help ensure continued cultural variety in a city that desprately needs it.

Thank you for taking the time to consider our campaign! Please help spread the word!
story_txt:
Hartford New Music Festival
The Second Annual Hartford New Music Festival will take place on May 5th, 2012 at 2pm in the historic Charter Oak Cultural Center. This year's festival features performers, composer and ensembles from Connecticut, New England, New York and beyond presenting a mixture of new work paired with modern classics. This year's festival includes:

The first ever HNMF Commission! This year's commission went to New Haven based singer/composer Anne Rhodes who is creating a large-scale handstitched graphic score to be performed by an ensemble
premeries of new works by Robert Carl, Todd Merrell and Marc Burns, along with works by Cenk Ergun, Kirsten Volness, Chris Cerrone, Feng-Hsu Lee, Jocelyn Ho, Matt Sargent, Anthony Braxton, Alvin Lucier, John Cage, Frederic Rzewski, Michel van der Aa and Hanns Eisler
performances by Jeffrey Kreiger, EXILKABARETT, Jessie Marino, Duo Oboe Agusto, Ensemble 016, and MANY OTHERS!
sound and video installations by NewMusicNewMediaNewEngland and others

The 2011 Edition of HNMF was a great success, including a great review in the Courant, as well as three packed concerts of excited audiences. Help our campaign to make this year's festival even better! 


What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise at least $500 to support the costs of the festival, which include the HNMF Commission Fund, venue staffing and travel stipends for out-of-town performers. This is just a percentage of the total cost of the festival, so we would love to raise even more than this!

story:
My mission

Hello music lovers, my name is Cait Cuneo and I am a music artist. Recently, I have been working endlessly on my first E.P. "Violet" I am hoping to release it this fall along with my first music video. "Violet" stands for strength, women empowerment, heart, light, guidance, and individuality. Within the E.P. you will hear the concrete struggle that was necessary in order for me to develop my strength and find my own voice. Each musician, and the production team involved on the record are close friends and family. This has allowed the music to be honest and limitless.

The purpose of this campaign is to get my project off the ground and start spreading this music for the world to hear. My hope is that this music can influence people with its positive message. I believe that everyone has a dream that deserves notice, and that is why I write, sing, and perform music. The necessary steps needed to start this journey is a record ready for distribution, a music video, and a band to bring these new songs to life. With your support spiritually and financially, each of you can be a key part of my personal music goal.

 

What I Need & What You Get

With every successful goal comes a great story. I want you all to be a part of this story that has brought me to this profession. To get me to this next musical step in my career, I will need some financial backing to make these steps. I have set the financial goal to $10,000, because this will be the minimum cost of making these 3 necessary steps a reality.

1. These funds will first go to mixing and mastering the music on the E.P., which will then be printed to cd, vinyl, and available digitally. "Violet" will first be sent to the people help me get to this goal. It will then be sent to radio stations and other promotional tracks around the world to attract new listeners to my music.

2. The next step, is to release this music with a surprise performance of all the music I have been working on. There are many aspects to putting on a concert that entail great financial backing. Promotions; including posters, flyers, newspaper ads, and radio support, allow new and current fans to be informed about this first performance. I am using all professional musicians that all deserve to be properly paid for their talent, skill, and time spent on making my project come to life. Paying for proper lighting and a sound engineer are necessary to make this performance look and sound great. With your help, you can share this experience with me and be right my side for this whole process. The perks offered will give you physical and mental memories that I hope last for a lifetime.

3. The final step to bring my project to the view of worldwide listeners is a music video. This takes hiring professional videographers that will make one song portray my heart and soul in a several minute video. I believe in making the highest quality video possible because I believe that is what my fans deserve. If completed, all who donated will get a private screening of the video before it is released to the public. Some will have a chance to be in the shooting of the music video

The Impact

If the goal is met, I will forever will be grateful to all who donated or helped spread the word about my music. You will be rewarded with not only these perks below, but my lifetime dedication to making music. If my financial goal is not met, I will use the funds donated to make as many steps possible towards my mission. And, I will reward those who donated for their belief in me as an artist. If the goal goes over the limit I have set, this will only enhance the experience that I hope to share with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can or cannot donate, please help spread this word to family, friends, and any person that loves music. Also you can use the various share tools created by Indie Go Go that works for multiple forms of media. Please share this picture below on social media (i.e. facebook, twitter, instagram, etc.) and via email to everyone you can.

story:
Who am I?

I'm Nick Menn, a member of Doorway the "River Front Time's Best Hip-Hop Group in St. Louis 2012, 2013" and recent recipient of the title of "River Front Time's Best Hip Hop Artist in St. Louis 2013". Welcome to Goon Road, an urban legend that hits too close to home for me. Follow close, our story has already begun at the top of Hill 1... 

The Run Down...

Welcome to Goon Road:

The album and concept behind GOON ROAD is inspired by the combination of the haunted road I grew up on, the haunting realities of living a drug induced lifestyle, and being a struggling musician all while dealing with the issues of dealing with this crazy world. Goon Road, if searched on Google, will give you results about a haunted road, with a troubling, dark past. The story goes: Goon Road lies somewhere in the woods in Southern Illinois ten minutes from St. Louis, Missouri. It's a private gravel road, riddled with no- trespassing signs, covered in brush, with three hills leading back into the woods. Eventually, the road ends up coming upon a private property with empty and abandoned houses, sheds, and barns. It's said that an inbred family used to live on the property, and would release their wild dogs on any trespassers This family would torture and brutally their captured prize. The road is an attraction for haunting buffs, and is a well- known urban legend in Illinois and the St. Louis area. This street that I’ve lived on since my adolescent years is named something completely different on your everyday street map, giving it a "normal neighborhood road" feeling. My friends and I used to go to the first hill on Goon Road when we were growing up to smoke, drink, and party, because it was in the woods where the cops and neighbors couldn't hear us. It is this combination of the actual haunted story and my upbringing (the years of "partying" on the road) that inspired me to create this concept album. 

What to expect from Hill Two:

Nick Menn’s second installment of the Goon Road Series ‘Hill Two’ starts right in the middle of the chaos and danger that is Goon Road. After ‘Hill One’, which is based mainly around the consumption of drugs and setting up the story line, ‘Hill Two’ finds Nick and his friends in the middle of the haunted road, drug induced, and full of panic and excitement at the same time. ‘Hill Two’ is packed with an array of emotions, from anxiety and fear, all the way to euphoria and false confidence. If ‘Hill One’ is drug consumption, ‘Hill Two’ is the drugs taking effect. ‘Hill Two’ puts the album in over-drive with its high energy, and bravado nature, as if Nick is seemingly not worried about the haunted story of Goon Road. ‘Hill Two’ is the part in the scary movie where the main character hears a sound, and instead of running away, goes to investigate the problem. What happens next is left up for listener to discover! ‘Hill Two’ features collaboration with legendary rap artist Killer Mike, as well as features from Tef Poe, Rockwell Knuckles, Doorway, and Sosy. Continue the ‘Goon Road’ experience with Nick Menn, and be on the lookout for ‘Hill Two’ EP coming soon!!


Check out the video for "Line Em Up", the single featured on Goon Road: Hill 1

The Packages:

This album is broken up in three separate EP's the way the real Goon Road features three hills. Each EP or "Hill" will be released through a separate Indiegogo which will be roughly a month long each and run back to back. The seperate Indiegogo releases will feature merchandise created specifically for themselves. These items will be made in very limited quantities and WILL NOT be pressed again. This is the only time you will be able to purchase these items... Once they are gone, they're gone.

story:
Sitali needs your help getting his third album, GOLDEN ONE, to the masses!

Welcome to Sitali's Indiegogo campaign for his third release, Golden One, and thanks in advance for your support!

About Sitali

Sitali follows in the tradition of visionaries whose music is at once explosive, provocative, emotional, and soaring under its own banner. It would be easy to dub his work "folk-rock” - and him a “singer-songwriter" - for the sake of the argument, but with a repertoire of sublime tracks that tinker with everything from Delta blues to country to funk to soul to punk rock, it wouldn’t do him justice. A mighty lyricist and a seasoned performer, he fiercely resides in a category all his own, evoking the legends that rocked, crooned, and strummed their way into his inimitable aesthetic.

It’s only fitting that Sitali was born in the Global Village - New York, New York - as his music and backstory reflect the rush and the riches of a journey across continents. Sitali’s parents were Zambian diplomats to the United Nations who, after their stint in Gotham, moved the family to Cairo, Egypt. It was there that, starting at age seven, he began learning the guitar, spurred on by the work of singer-songwriters such as Cat Stevens, Bob Dylan, and Johnny Cash.

After Cairo came Russia, and Sitali split his time between living with his family in Moscow and going to school in the United Kingdom. The move endowed Sitali with a host of new influences - namely Led Zeppelin, The Who, and Jimi Hendrix - who prompted his undying affair with the electric guitar.

Milestones that for most occur in adulthood came for Sitali in adolescence: He went on his first tour at 13 as a Zambian representative for the UNICEF-sponsored International Youth Festival; and at 14 he had his first recording session, performing with father and son Ethan and Glynn Johns, producers of Led Zeppelin, The Who, Ray La Montagne, and Kings of Leon.

Sitali moved back to the U.S. after completing high school and touched down in Washington, DC, where he immediately started playing the club scene, meeting key players such as Federico Gonzalez Peña, keyboardist for Marcus Miller; Spyro Gyra’s Scott Ambush; songstress/powerhouse Meshell Ndegeocello; and Juju House, drummer for the likes of Grace Jones, Chuck Brown, Arrested Development, and others.

During this prolific period, he also spent some time in New York, playing gigs at the Blue Note Jazz Club with several renowned musicians; and on the West Coast, writing, recording, and performing. While in Seattle, he reconnected with Juju House who hired him for a writing project for singer Roberta Flack, for whom Juju was drumming at the time.

When Sitali landed back in DC, he recorded and released his debut album, the heavily Delta blues-flavored I Am a Tree. Released in 2005, it features Juju on drums; Scott Ambush on bass; and the late Ben Andrews, legendary Delta blues singer and guitarist, who performs a special acoustic track on the record called "Black Star Revisited".


For his his 2008 album, Aluta Continua, Sitali linked up with engineer/producer/collaborator Frank Marchand, who has recorded and mixed for a host of pivotal artists - Nils Lofgren, Bob Mould of Husker Du, and The Decemberists, to name a few. Though as potent in lyrics and melody as I Am a Tree, Aluta Continua captures rock and blues on a much rawer scale and features Jean-Francis Varre on bass and John Lane on drums. 

After completing his second album, Sitali took some time away from production and spent a year and a half touring with DC-based DJ collective Thievery Corporation, performing to large crowds across the U.S. The tour introduced Sitali to huge audiences, as it made stops at such festivals as Bonnaroo, Lollapalooza, Outside Lands, South by Southwest, and many others.

Which Brings Us to GOLDEN ONE...

Sitali is now back in the studio once more, again collaborating with Frank Marchand, for his new album, Golden One. This project is a soulful and full-bodied bomb of tones and genres, featuring a horn section; string section Machines on Vacation (fronted by Ethan Balis); and the talents of Dr. Huda Asfour, master of the Palestinian oud and kanoun. Thievery Corporation engineer Giamma Conti is also lending his expertise to the project, as is Juju House, who appears on drums.

With the launch of this Indiegogo campaign, Sitali hopes to release Golden One in the fall of 2014. Your contributions will be instrumental in getting the album fully completed and promoted. With a goal of $15,000, the funds will be distributed as follows:

  • $2,000 for art stuff - website, artwork, photography, Indiegogo video production
  • $3,000 to finish the album - mixing and mastering
  • $5,000 to music production company IQ Beats in Seattle for additional tracking
  • $2,000 for travel expenses to Seattle
  • $2,000 for supplies - CDs, promo posters, etc.
  • $1,000 for internet radio promo

For Your Efforts, You Get Cool Stuff

We've put together a list of badass perks to get you revved to donate! There's something for every budget - from thank-you postcards to private concerts - and we are ever so grateful for every gift. Plus you know you need a Sitali T-shirt in your life.

Your Impact

Every contribution to this campaign will have a formidable impact. Sitali is poised to bring his music to audiences who are tired of the proverbial standards and ready for a recording for the ages. Getting Golden One out into the universe - and consequently Sitali onto stages, on the airwaves, and into the festival circuit - will be your legacy as well. This is a special opportunity to give rise to one of the most original and deserving musicians yet to be discovered by the general public, and you'll get the props for helping him into the spotlight.

    Thank You!

    Thanks to all of you for your amazing support! If you have any questions, please contact Yillah, Sitali's campaign manager, via email at yillahnatalia@gmail.com. 

    Also, please spread the word on social media! Hit us up via Twitter @yillahn and @SitaliMusic, and give Sitali a "like" on Facebook.

story:
Our History

Since March 2007, Sofia Garcia, Lucho Garcia and Jerónimo Gonzalez are better known as BONNIE , pop/ rock band from Montevideo, Uruguay.

Since then, we are working hard to achieve our goals, keep making music and get better every day.

After recording an EP: "Showtime" in 2009, a  full length album: "Bonnie" in 2011, a Live DVD: " The Bonnie Live Project" in 2012 and a single: "Paradise" in 2014", its time to move forward to our most ambicious project: A second full lenght album recorded with two of the most important producers in Argentina; Sebastian Bazan and Karen Oliver.

Anyone who really knows us, will tell you how hard we been working all these years to keep making music. And we dont want to STOP!! Because of our fans, but also, because of ourselves...

And this is a perfect moment for a second album; We want to show our new songs to the world, and we need your help to achieve this. I mean, we really need you to make this happen!

If you make a quick research to  our links all over internet, you will know we like to make things right:



This is what we need

- USD 5000 to pay for the whole professional production of 8 original songs, recorded in the best studios of Argentina, and produced with top notch producers. It will be a digital album, as manufacturing and printing is getting really expensive these days.

How can you help?

- Investing the money you can/ want: We offer some incentives where you can get all our discography in any format.

- Spread the word: If you cant give us an economic help, you can do a lot just by spreading the word about our campaign! Friends, family, neighbours, office partners, everybody can love our music...!


Thanks for your time! Lets hope we can make this together!!

Yours,

BONNIE

Sofi, Lucho, Jero

Our HistorySince March 2007, Sofia Garcia, Lucho Garcia and Jerónimo Gonzalez are better known as BONNIE , pop/ rock band from Montevideo, Uruguay.Since then, we are working hard to achieve our goals, keep making music and get better every day.After recording an EP: "Showtime" in 2009, a  full length album: "Bonnie" in 2011, a Live DVD: " The Bonnie Live Project" in 2012 and a single: "Paradise" in 2014", its time to move forward to our most ambicious project: A second full lenght album recorded with two of the most important producers in Argentina; Sebastian Bazan and Karen Oliver.Anyone who really knows us, will tell you how hard we been working all these years to keep making music. And we dont want to STOP!! Because of our fans, but also, because of ourselves...And this is a perfect moment for a second album; We want to show our new songs to the world, and we need your help to achieve this. I mean, we really need you to make this happen!If you make a quick research to  our links all over internet, you will know we like to make things right:
This is what we need- USD 5000 to pay for the whole professional production of 8 original songs, recorded in the best studios of Argentina, and produced with top notch producers. It will be a digital album, as manufacturing and printing is getting really expensive these days.How can you help?- Investing the money you can/ want: We offer some incentives where you can get all our discography in any format.- Spread the word: If you cant give us an economic help, you can do a lot just by spreading the word about our campaign! Friends, family, neighbours, office partners, everybody can love our music...!Thanks for your time! Lets hope we can make this together!!Yours,BONNIESofi, Lucho, Jero

story:
*** As we count down the final hours of this campaign, we'd like to thank everyone who has already donated, and encourage everyone to keep spreading the word. We'd also like to remind people that everyone who donates is eligible for the draw for 2 bronze passes to the 2015 TD Ottawa International Jazz Festival. ***


Short Summary

My name is Elise Letourneau. I am a multiple award-winning composer with more than 30 years experience working in music. Since December 2013 I have been composing a requiem to commemorate the upcoming 25th Anniversary of the École Polytechnique Massacre.

On December 6, 1989, a gunman entered École Polytechnique in Montreal and started shooting, killing 14 young women and injuring 10 other women and 4 men before turning the gun on himself.
"Requiem for Fourteen Roses" will be performed at Knox Presbyterian Church in Ottawa the evening of Saturday December 6, 2014 -- 25 years to the day after the tragedy took place. The work is for vocal soloist, choir, and 8-piece chamber ensemble.

What We Need & What You Get

Creating an event like this is expensive. The project budget is broken down into the following areas:

  • creating and printing the music scores
  • hiring the performers
  • performance venue
  • tech details: i.e. stage manager, piano tuning, recording, simulcasting
  • printing: i.e. promotional bookmarks and posters, tickets, concert programs

No donation amount is too small, and all donations will be acknowledged on the Requiem for Fourteen Roses blog, but be sure to look over our fundraising perks. All of them support artists and the arts, and your gift has even further reach!

(Please note: the date for the concert at the $250 perk level is TBA. Watch for updates. Thanks!)

(UPDATE! The concert date for the above-mentioned perk is March 22, 2015)

The Impact

Written to commemorate the 25th Anniversary of the École Polytechnique Massacre, "Requiem for Fourteen Roses" is a concert-length work for female vocal soloist, choir, flute, 2 flugelhorns, 2 trombones, cello, contrabass, and piano. It begins with 14 tolls of a bell while roses are laid, and continues with instrumental, vocal, and choral music.

Though not written specifically as a religious work, the choir does sing some sections of the traditional mass, as well as the 23rd Psalm, in French. The choir also has sections to sing in English, using texts by Rabindranath Tagore, who won a Nobel prize for his work.

The female soloist sings music composed to contemporary sonnets from the Governor General's Award-winning book, "Woman at a Piano" by poet Ted Blodgett, who has graciously granted permission for his work to be used in this context. Sienna Dahlen has accepted to perform the works. She is one of Canada's most original and versatile singer-composers-multi-instrumentalists whose music spans folk, jazz, and experimental styles. Sienna is the featured vocalist on "Notes on Montreal", the CD by Montreal-based composer/guitarist Mike Rud that received this year's Juno award for vocal jazz.

Interspersed among the vocal works are fourteen short instrumental vignettes to be performed by the brass quartet, one for each of the young women who were murdered.

This project has significance for me as a composer of vocal music, but also as a Canadian woman. Like many of the young women who were lost, I was born in the second half of the 1960s. I have often stopped to wonder what they might be doing now had their lives not been cut short. The 25th anniversary is significant because 25 years represents a generation of Canadians, and a generation is long enough to forget. For many, the event and its memorials have come to represent violence against women, and though this is important, I view this music project in larger terms. There are so many forms of violence in our society: against women, children, men, animals, the Earth, our very selves, and more. Simply put, we must learn to be good to each other, and in addition to the fourteen young women who lost their lives on December 6 - 1989, I dedicate this work to the good that resides in each of us.

Risks & Challenges

Essentially, the success of this campaign will determine how amazing the concert can become, and what our technical options for documenting and sharing the concert will be. We are set up for the Flex Funding option, which means that if we don't reach the $10,000 goal, we will still receive the money that is raised. But we will have to reevaluate some of our budget details. And bite our nails over ticket sales. Regardless, we are committed to delivering this project, however our campaign plays out.

We are grateful to have received a Corel Award towards this project from the Ottawa Arts Council. A successful crowd funding campaign will free up additional hours to focus on the creative aspects of this project, rather than dedicating additional resources to researching grants and writing time-consuming applications that may or may not result in funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Word of mouth. Help us spread the word about "Requiem for Fourteen Roses".
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, and/or share on Facebook and Twitter! With all the different ways we now connect with one another, when you post links you are helping us reach places we wouldn't reach on our own.
  • Join us at the concert on December 6 if you are in or near Ottawa ON.

Composer's Bio


Elise Letourneau is an accomplished performer, composer, arranger, and educator. She established and directs Vox Eclectica Women's Chamber Choir. Elise is also the founding music director of Capital Vox Jazz Choir, which has been heralded as Canada's first community jazz choir.


With her background in classical, jazz, and contemporary styles, Elise brings a varied palette of sound and experience to her music. An associate composer of the Canadian Music Centre, she composed the winning entries of the 2011 Ruth Watson Henderson Composition Competition and the 2012 ACCC Choral Composition Competition. She received the inaugural Diane Loomer Award. She was shortlisted twice as a finalist for The 2013 & 2014 American Prize in choral composition. Her music has been sung by the Vancouver Chamber Choir, Canada's National Youth Choir, the Toronto Children's Chorus, the Cantiamo Children’s Choir, and others. Her catalogue includes works of new music for voice, choir, piano, string quartet, and winds; as well as an additional selection of songs, big band charts, and hundreds of choral arrangements.


Elise Letourneau has an active performance schedule. She has performed and recorded with a variety of artists including vocal jazz treasure and NEA Jazz Master award winner Sheila Jordan, baritone Marcus Nance, pianist Brian Browne, saxophonist-composer Oliver Lake, pianist Harry Pickens, drummer Roger Humphries, Grammy-nominated jazz vocalist Janet Lawson, performance-poet Huang Xiang, jazzman Bob Dorough, singer-songwriter Paula Cole, pianist Dan Haerle, and the Impressions in Jazz Orchestra. She was selected for inclusion on the Pennsylvania Performing Arts on Tour artist roster, and has performed throughout the Mid-Atlantic region of the United States and throughout Ontario.


Elise instructs students in composition, piano, voice, and flute; and she is on the faculty at Carleton University and Alcorn Music Studios. She is recording her fourth CD. Her publishers include Cypress Choral Music and Diamond in the Square Music. Elise is a graduate of Boston's Berklee College of Music, where she earned her B.Mus. in composition and arranging, and she also studied at Humber College. She earned a M.Ed. specializing in creative arts and learning at Lesley College in Cambridge MA. She lives in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

story:
Short Summary

The two-day non-profit Northern Rockies Music Festival takes place in Hailey, a community that loves its live music. It's held in a lovely park alongside the Big Wood River, in South Central Idaho. The Festival has defined summertime for more than three decades. It serves an area and community often overlooked, for its splashier neighbor to the north, Sun Valley. The Festival features the music of national, regional and local bands. Folks dance, chat, swim in the river and share picnics while children play on the huge community-built playground. They walk and ride bikes. There are merch sales, art vendors and food trucks, raffles, and overnight camping. The town of Hailey, full of restaurants, bars and shopping is a short walk away.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Northern Rockies Music Festival seeks to raise funds to guarantee that the show continues uninterrupted into the future for future generations.
  • Donors will receive free tickets to the 2015 show, tee-shirts and more!
  • All funds will go to pay outstanding bills and to prepare for the 2015 show.

The Impact

  • We believe the Northern Rockies Music Festival is important to the area. Many people who come to the festival year after year do so becasue its a causal, easy festival where people of all ages co-mingle while enjoying the music. We work hard to bring in emerging artists thus exposing the audience to exciting, new music.
  • The Festival regularly showcases local talent with an emphasis on youth, and has offered outreach help to traveling music students.
  • The Festival is a signature event in the summer for many in the Wood River Valley and beyond. Family and school reunions are frequently held at the Festival. It has been shown that art tourism, which includes music, helps to benefit and strengthen a town's economy.
  • With your help we can move forward.

Risks & Challenges

  • Sure, there are other regional music festivals now. And there are lots of choices and decisions to be made about travel and financial commitments. But the Northern Rockies Music Festival has been steadfast - an event for the whole family that miraculously manages to delight and entertain year after year. It remains one of the most affordable events in the area.
  • We've produced this festival for 38-years, and take great pride in bringing a wide variety of music -- country, zydeco, and jazz to rock, roots and folk -- to the Wood River Valley.
  • We will continue to seek sponsorships from businesses in the area, and apply for appropriate grants.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Mark your calendars for the 2015 Festival to be held, July 31 and Aug. 1.
  • Help us get the word out so that we can all revel in the on-going mission of the festival to bring great music to our area, and to celebrate our community.
  • Please share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family.
  • Use your Facebook, Email, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram (and other) accounts!
  • Volunteer to help at the 2015 Northern Rockies Music Festival.

story:
Hello, we are Brewster Productions.

On July 21st, we'll be presenting the Plymouth Independent Music Festival (PIMF) at Nelson Park, Plymouth, MA. It'll be a whole day of awesome free music. Headlining the show are Jake Hill & Deep Creek and Rodeo Ruby Love.

How we got here

In 2007, after years of frustration with the local music circuit, we decided that Plymouth needed an all-day free music festival for us young folks. The bands needed a place to play, and the fans needed a place to hear music they loved.

Five years later, the Plymouth Independent Music Festival is a thriving mid-summer celebration of original music. Weâ€™ve still got the rag-tag, grassroots spirit we started with â€“ the 8-hour-long festival is staffed by 8 or so volunteers, and yes itâ€™s a bit rough around the edges, but thatâ€™s what makes it so fun.

We started this thing when we were 20 years old (founders Scott, Jon, and Harry), and every year weâ€™re still more and more excited about the show, even at the ripe old age of 25... help us keep it growing.

Great for Plymouth, great for the scene

Our favorite thing about producing these free summer shows is the sense of community that forms around the events and the music. Our main goals are to help musicians get their work out into the world, and to contribute in a positive way to Plymouthâ€™s bustling summer economy.

What we need & what you'll get

The great thing about donating to the PIMF is that you can come right down to the show on July 21st and see your much-appreciated money at work. In addition to that, we'll give you some fun things like stickers, music, backstage passes, and even the opportunity to introduce a band on stage at the show.

An all-day festival takes a lot of time, energy, and money to pull off â€“ weâ€™ve got the first two of those covered (and those can often make up for a lack of #3), but we need donations and advertising to raise enough cash to make this show as great as it can be.

How will we use the money?

The answer(s): Equipment, food, drinks, insurance, promotion, and, of course, music. Weâ€™ve got some equipment upgrades that need to happen before the show, and even things like cables and mic stands can really add up when you need a lot of them. Weâ€™re fortunate enough to work with some bands who volunteer their time, or play for food and gas money (and merch sales...buy CDs at the show!), but that all costs some money. We also need to feed and hydrate everyone whoâ€™s working at the show, and on top of that, we need to get insurance coverage for the day.

All in all, $3,000 isnâ€™t a whole lot for a music festival â€“ but trust us: If you help us raise it, youâ€™re going to have one hell of a show in store for you on July 21st.

Other Ways You Can Help

We canâ€™t thank you enough for donating to the PIMF, but weâ€™d be even more eternally-grateful if you'd spread the word about the show, the bands, and this page to help us raise some more funds. Youâ€™re the best. See you at the show!

You can find our official news, Facebook events, photos, and more at the links below.
