story:
(Se under for beskrivelsen på Norsk)

Hi friends, music lovers, and supporters of workplace health!  

The inspiration for Workplace Singing came originally from my experience directing a workplace choir in Norway seven years ago. Those choir members came from their workday to choir with such joy!

I have directed a workplace choir in Nelson BC for the past six years, which has only reinforced what I already knew: that singing together with a group of people creates a group cohesion and sense of harmony that you don't get in any other way. Singing brings joy and energy to individuals in the group, and even if some people arrive tired, grumpy, or stressed, we all leave energized and happy. 

How your donations will help this project! 

Your donations will make possible the advertising, already underway, to inspire Norwegian companies to try Workplace Singing. Next, the funds generated will pay for a work permit (substantial!) and support the director and creator of this project (me!) until the project becomes self-sufficient in September.

If the pledges reach beyond the goal of $3,000.00, the project will have even more foundation for success. I will then be able to put all my focus into showing companies how this project will benefit them, and ultimately, how it will benefit the world, as employees begin to enjoy their work more, connect with their colleagues, and return home from work energized and open-hearted.

So, here's how you can help: Pledge a little more if you are able, and more than anything, share, Share SHARE!! Share it on your facebook page, or better still, Send the link out to all your friends and contacts. Tell them what you love about the project. You will be giving a gift to the employees who will sing together next year, and to those who will discover Workplace Singing when it comes to Canada and the US in future years. 

And now, more about me and how this will work!

Through years of teaching many different groups, I have developed a keen ability to know what a group will be able to do in a given amount of time, and people are often amazed at how good their group sounds in the end. In our day and age, "I can't sing" is a much-repeated phrase.

In my experience, everyone can sing if the desire is there. In a group of people who work together, there will always be a range of ability, and those who are not accustomed to singing are supported by the strong voices of those who sing confidently. I always start small, humming together and listening to each other, then teaching one or two simple, gentle and fun voice exercises. The first songs I teach a group, are songs that are in a middle range, with melodies that are easy to connect with. I teach a range of styles, from slow and beautiful, to joyful and upbeat, quirky and funny. If there is time, if a group has strength in numbers, or a few confident singers to support, we move on to singing with harmonies and exciting rhythms. It's always fun, and there is always something for everyone.

The experience will be different for each workplace, depending on the number of people, range of people, and depending on how much time they commit to singing together. But it will always give employees a renewed enthusiasm for what they are doing, and for working together. 

I look forward to expanding this work from one choir to several workplace groups of varied sizes, abilities and personalities! Thank you so much for your support!

 

THANK YOU for your time, help and support!!!

SPREAD THE WORD....

Facebook           Texting             Word of mouth          Phone calls

Myspace             Twitter              Email                     Handwritten letters

 

 

 

På Norsk: 

Hei venner, musikkelskere, og støttere av arbeidsplass velvære!

Inspirasjon for “sang på arbeidsplassen” kom opprinelig fra da jeg dirigerte et bedriftskor i Oslo for syv år siden. Kor medlemmene kom fra arbeidsdagen med så mye gleden!

Jeg har dirigert et arbeidsplassen kor i Nelson BC i de siste seks årene som bare har forsterket det som jeg allerede visste: at å synge sammen med en gruppe mennesker skaper en gruppesamhold og følelse av harmoni som du ikke får på noen annen måte. Dessuten, at synging bringer glede og energi til individene i gruppen, og at selv om noen mennesker kommer trøtt, gretten, eller stresset, vil alle dra energiske og glade.

Hvordan dine bidrag vil hjelpe dette prosjektet: 

Ditt bidrag vil gjøre reklame mulig for å inspirere norske bedrifter til å prøve “Sang på arbeidsplassen”, samt en begynnerlønn for å støtte meg, direktør og skaperen av dette prosjektet, frem til prosjektet blir selvforsynt i september.

Dersom dette prosjektet løfter nå utover målet på $ 3,000.00, vil prosjektet ha enda mer grunnlag for suksess. Jeg vil da kunne sette all min fokus til å vise selskapene hvordan dette prosjektet vil gavne dem, og til slutt, hvordan det vil nytte verden, når ansatte begynner å trives mer, få god kontakt med sine kolleger, og kommer hjem fra jobb oppfrisket og åpenhjertige.

Så, her er hvordan du kan hjelpe: å love litt mer til prosjektet hvis du er i stand, og mer enn noe, dele og spred budskapet! Send linken ut til alle dine venner og kontakter. Fortell dem hva du liker med prosjektet. Sånn gir du en gave til de ansatte som vil synge sammen neste år, og fremover.

Og nå mer om meg og hvordan dette fungerer!

Gjennom mange års undervisning mange ulike grupper, har jeg en utviklet evne til å vite hva en gruppe kan oppnå på en bestemt tid, og folk har vært overasket over hvor bra gruppen høres ut til slutt. I vår tid er "Jeg kan ikke synge" en mye gjentatt frase. Min erfaring er at alle kan synge hvis ønsket er der. I en gruppe mennesker som jobber sammen, vil det alltid være en forskjellige evnen, og de som ikke er vant til å synge er støttet av de sterke stemmene til dem som synger trygt. Jeg begynner alltid enkelt. Vi nynner sammen og lytter til hverandre, så underviser jeg en eller to enkle, skånsome og morsom taleøvelser.

De første sangene jeg underviser en gruppe er sanger som er i en middels rekkevidde, med melodier som er lette å få kontakt med. Jeg underviser en rekke stilarter, fra sakte og vakkert, til glade og upbeat, eksentriske og morsomme. Dersom tiden strekker, hvis en gruppe har styrke i antall, eller har noen selvsikre sangere å støtte seg på, beveger vi oss videre til å synge med harmonier og morsomme rytmer.

Den erfaringen vil være forskjellig for hver arbeidsplass, avhengig av antall personer, utvalg av personer, og avhengig av hvor mye tid de forplikter seg til å synge sammen. Men det vil alltid være morsomt, og vil gi de ansatte en fornyet entusiasme for hva de gjør, og for å arbeide sammen.

Jeg gleder meg til å utvide dette arbeidet fra ett kor til flere arbeidsplass-grupper av forskjellige størrelser, evner og personlighet! Takk så mye for støtten!
story_txt:
(Se under for beskrivelsen på Norsk)

Hi friends, music lovers, and supporters of workplace health!  
The inspiration for Workplace Singing came originally from my experience directing a workplace choir in Norway seven years ago. Those choir members came from their workday to choir with such joy!
I have directed a workplace choir in Nelson BC for the past six years, which has only reinforced what I already knew: that singing together with a group of people creates a group cohesion and sense of harmony that you don't get in any other way. Singing brings joy and energy to individuals in the group, and even if some people arrive tired, grumpy, or stressed, we all leave energized and happy. 

How your donations will help this project! 
Your donations will make possible the advertising, already underway, to inspire Norwegian companies to try Workplace Singing. Next, the funds generated will pay for a work permit (substantial!) and support the director and creator of this project (me!) until the project becomes self-sufficient in September.
If the pledges reach beyond the goal of $3,000.00, the project will have even more foundation for success. I will then be able to put all my focus into showing companies how this project will benefit them, and ultimately, how it will benefit the world, as employees begin to enjoy their work more, connect with their colleagues, and return home from work energized and open-hearted.
So, here's how you can help: Pledge a little more if you are able, and more than anything, share, Share SHARE!! Share it on your facebook page, or better still, Send the link out to all your friends and contacts. Tell them what you love about the project. You will be giving a gift to the employees who will sing together next year, and to those who will discover Workplace Singing when it comes to Canada and the US in future years. 
And now, more about me and how this will work! 
Through years of teaching many different groups, I have developed a keen ability to know what a group will be able to do in a given amount of time, and people are often amazed at how good their group sounds in the end. In our day and age, "I can't sing" is a much-repeated phrase.
In my experience, everyone can sing if the desire is there. In a group of people who work together, there will always be a range of ability, and those who are not accustomed to singing are supported by the strong voices of those who sing confidently. I always start small, humming together and listening to each other, then teaching one or two simple, gentle and fun voice exercises. The first songs I teach a group, are songs that are in a middle range, with melodies that are easy to connect with. I teach a range of styles, from slow and beautiful, to joyful and upbeat, quirky and funny. If there is time, if a group has strength in numbers, or a few confident singers to support, we move on to singing with harmonies and exciting rhythms. It's always fun, and there is always something for everyone.
The experience will be different for each workplace, depending on the number of people, range of people, and depending on how much time they commit to singing together. But it will always give employees a renewed enthusiasm for what they are doing, and for working together. 
I look forward to expanding this work from one choir to several workplace groups of varied sizes, abilities and personalities! Thank you so much for your support!
 
THANK YOU for your time, help and support!!!
SPREAD THE WORD....
Facebook           Texting             Word of mouth          Phone calls
Myspace             Twitter              Email                     Handwritten letters
 
 
 
På Norsk:

story:
The Kane Kids (Topher, Meghan & TJ) are part of the 8th grade honors symphonic band at Cane Creek Middle School. Their band has been chosen to play at the Carnegie Hall Festival over Easter weekend 2014 (1 of only 4 middle schools in the country chosen!) This is an incredible opportunity for them, to say the least. Not many people are able to say they played at Carnegie Hall when they were 13 years old! {TJ plays the alto saxophone; Topher plays the trombone and tuba; Meghan plays the flute.  They are multi-talented.}
Needless to say, the cost of this trip is pretty steep and we need help in raising the funds to get them to Carnegie. Any assistance, no matter how small would be greatly appreciated and very helpful. They need to raise a total of $2000 to cover the cost of this trip.
In addition to this type of fundraising, they will be doing things such as a bake sale at church, playing on the sidewalks in downtown Asheville, doing a trio at a few local restaurants, playing outside a couple local stores. They are more than willing to put forth a great deal of effort as this is something they so want to do.
**Please be sure to click on the tabs on the site: updates, comments, gallery for more information, more videos and more photos.  If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

Further information

We have included documents showing the cost breakdown of the trip and the tentative itinerary so you have a full picture of where the funds are going, how they are going to be used, etc.  The entire band will also be doing group fundraisers to bring the costs down per student.  The hope/plan is to get the cost per student down to approximately $500/student which is what we have based our personal fundraising goal on.
IF we surpass our personal fundraising goal, any excess funds will go toward the group fundraising project to assist in lowering the costs for the group or to help another student in the band who may be struggling to raise funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we totally understand that.  Can you simply spread the word to your family and friends about what we are trying to do?  That would be a great help!  Thanks!

story:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SAMPLE #BROTHERHOOD (phase 4 mix)
<3 click bellow <3

 <3 #BROTHERHOOD Tony Almonte feat. Bran Van 3000 <3

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


About Tony Almonte


Tony Almonte is a singer-songwriter, musician and composer hailing from Montreal, Canada. His years of experience as a front-man, session player, DJ, and radio host have all helped establish Tony Almonte as a versatile artist and performer. Tony developed his taste for music and performance as a young boy following in his father’s footsteps. At the age of six, young Almonte was pulled on stage alongside the Doobie Brothers during their Farewell Tour to play the cowbell.  


His first stage experience (cowbell moment) set the tone for the rest of his career: Tony has performed, recorded, and toured with several outfits north of the American border as well as bands and DJs from different parts of the globe, such as Grammy Award winners Little Louie Vega & David Morales, Kokolo Afrobeat Orchestra, Tony Okungbowa (from Ellen DeGeneres show), and performs regularly at Club Peopl with Jojo Flores.

Photo: Grammy Award winner Louie Vega, Tony almonte & Jojo Flores



About the Tony Almonte Project "TAP"


As of today, he has around 400 songs written and ready to go. He has received blessings and endorsements from prominent musicians and industry figures such as Kahil El’Zabar, members of Bran Van 3000, D.D. Jackson, Denis Savage and Dominic Messier from Céline Dion’s production team, and Sennheiser Canada.

A soul oriented, funk-driven project, the songs and melodies are crafted with a direct approach to hit-making. In such, maximizing each song’s hit potential to making the music radio-ready for today’s global market.

The Tony Almonte Project consists of Tony and four younger musicians from different hemispheres of life, who all came together in 2013. Walt Druce from Australia on guitar, David Gutierrez Osei-Afrifa from Montreal on keyboards, Vincent Lafrance from Montreal on bass, and Peter Colantonio from Toronto on drums.


Where We Are Now


Photo: Walt Druce, Peter Colantonio, Vincent Lafrance, Tony Almonte

TAP has been recording since January and are right now putting the finishing touches on our debut album in Montreal. We are now looking towards the mixing/mastering phase.

We plan on releasing the first single Brotherhood Tale on September 1st. It features Juno award recipients James Disalvio, Gary Mackenzie and Nick Hynes from Bran Van 3000. The Tony Almonte Project album will be released shortly after, featuring original songs penned and crafted by Tony Almonte.


Why Contribute?


We would be delighted if you would consider yourself a part of this special project! Our perks range from acquiring the digital album, to VIP/executive privileges, a full range of Tony Almonte Project shows in your area, customized songs for your listening pleasure and much more! By contributing & sharing this Indiegogo page... you might feel a slightly soulful tingling of happiness inside! 


The 75,000$ will be going towards the following:


-Mixing

-Mastering

-Production cost (Studio time, engineer)

-CD/vinyl production/manufacturing

-Merchandise

-Music Videos

-Album Launch in NYC

-Management


Share your views on the project with all your friends.
Help us rock this campaign! #cometogether


You can follow us on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Youtube, Vimeo, Flickr, etc.


@tonyalmonteproj


*The tentative delivery dates are :

First Single- September 1st, 2014

TAP - Full Album - Fall 2014

story:
Sienna's Song

I am the mother of Sienna Isabella Safari Widd:  a child of Africa.  She has a unique song to sing. She has a deep heart to share.   She is the song of the heart, at the heart of Africa.

Her dream is to receive the best support possible to share her gift with the world.    We've found a private high school in Cape Town that can offer her the training she needs, and need to raise SAR15,000.00 by 29 April as a deposit to ensure she gets her place at St Cyprians' in January 2015.

Sienna's Kenyan father was murdered 8 years ago and she's always only ever had me to support her.  If I don't believe in her, and support her dream, who will?  I cannot afford this magnificent school on my single parent income, but I can keep believing, and I can keep exploring every avenue possible.  I won't give up until the universe tells me to stop.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise a minimum of SAR 15,000.00 to ensure her place for January 2015 - DONE, THANK YOU!!!!
  • Any additional funds will go towards the R10K annual levy and her school fees next year
  • You get to know you are supporting a truly talented, deserving and beautiful star-in-the-making, our eternal gratitude, updated progress reports and videos of her singing, as well as an autographed, limited edition of the first album she ever releases!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with funding, we would also really appreciate:

  • Donated studio time to record Sienna singing with some musicians and backing singers - we would like to film the session and submit it with music scholarship applications for 2016
  • Music and arts scholarships and bursaries that you may know of for high school pupils in South Africa
  • Your faith, love and prayers

story:
THANK YOU TO THE MOON AND BACK!! WE'VE MADE IT! 

NOW TIME FOR SOME STRETCHING. 

Or more icing : )

Thanks to you, my campaign has reached its goal!!! I had no idea what to expect when I started this campaign less than a month ago, and I am so thankful for everyone’s support. Nearly 250 people have decided to help me record my first album. Some are family, others friends, members of my community, and many I don’t even know but felt generous enough to help me make music. It has been amazing to see how supportive everyone has been. I feel so inspired, excited and confident that you won't be disappointed in the final product : )

Moreover, BECAUSE I've already accomplished my goal and still have two days left before the campaign ends, I'd like to offer some stretch goals. $25,000 will produce a beautiful album, but there’s more I’d like to do.

If I am able to reach the following total amounts by midnight on the 28th, I will be able to do more and you can be rewarded for any additional support you can give. 

$27,000 --- I will be able to get professional press photos done. If I reach this goal, everyone who contributed $100 or more will get a signed print from the photo shoot.

$30,000 --- I will be able to hire a professional graphic designer to design the artwork for the album. If I reach this goal, everyone who contributed $250 or more will get a custom lampshade from Chez Boheme, my mom's beautifully colorful antique store! (check it out here: www.chezboheme.com)

$35,000 ---- I will be able to produce a music video for one of the songs on the album. If I reach this goal, every single person who contributed to the campaign will get one free Putumayo or Cumbancha CD…Visit www.putumayo.com andwww.cumbancha.com to see what they're all about.  If you're lucky, you'll get the Vintage France album, which features yours truly …     : ) 

Thanks again to all you have done so far, but let’s not let it end here. You can increase your contribution or convince someone new who has not yet contributed to help keep this train rolling until midnight strikes on August 28th (midnight in California…deadline is Pacific Standard Time).

Merci! Merci! Merci!

Francesca

----------------------
[ POUR LIRE TOUT CA EN FRANCAIS, APPUYEZ ICI! ]

FRANCESCA WHO?

If you’d asked me seventeen years ago what I wanted to be when I grew up, I'd have answered, "archeologist!". Digging up dinosaur bones seemed thrilling. Perhaps my four-year-old self sought to discover and analyze ancient remnants of history; to study the transcendence of all living creatures here on earth, or I just loved playing in the dirt (but I'd like to think it was more romantic than that). Either way, four-year-old "Cheska" would never have answered that she felt destined to become a singer-songwriter. She wouldn't have pictured herself playing a guitar, let alone being able to pick one up! She'd never have guessed that, somewhere down the road, her biggest dream would be to sing songs that she’d written on her own - songs with words and melodies she’d yearn to share with the people she loved and with the world beyond.

My name is Francesca Blanchard, and I am a singer-songwriter, working to fund my first, full-length album. I was born and raised in France, with a French father and an American mother. Being born into two cultures, my life has consistently entailed a merging of these two identities. I grew up as a French girl, and found my initial identity on the sandy beaches off the Mediterranean coast. My father spoke to me in French; my mother, in English. After moving to Vermont in 2002, maintaining my French identity became difficult. Writing songs in the language, however, helped me preserve this essential part of myself.

MY MUSIC

At the age of fourteen, I learned to play “Blackbird” on my mom’s Ovation guitar. I started taking lessons and before I knew it, songs came out. I had stories to tell, feelings to express, and mom’s guitar became the catalyst for my newfound musical imagination.

My personal musical musings have led to a rush of opportunities that seem to be saying my dreams of having a successful career in music might not be fantasies at all. The response to my music has exceeded my wildest expectations. In the past two years, I have recorded a six-track EP, performed in Boston, London, Paris and across VT. I've opened for Suzanne Vega and Caravan Palace, appeared at the prestigious Francofolies Music Festival in Montreal and played at the Association for Performing Arts Presenters conference in NYC. I was featured on Putumayo's Vintage France collection and was a musical guest on numerous radio shows, including Vermont Public Radio. Interest from promoters, labels and booking agents in North America and Europe has been steadily growing, and I am blessed with an ever-expanding group of fans and supporters.

LISTEN TO MY DEMO OF "LE BLUES"

LISTEN TO MY DEMO OF "TU N'EXISTES PAS"


MY PLAN

For the past two years I have been gaining experience, composing and polishing new songs, learning the ins and outs of the music business, recording demos and finishing my college degree in Theatre Arts at Boston University. I am now ready to take giant steps towards a life of music and performance.

The money I raise with this campaign will be used to produce the best-quality album possible. I will be working alongside Montreal-based producer/singer-songwriter Chris Velan, with whom I’ve been in constant contact about my songs and the direction in which they should be taken. With a self-financed album in hand, I will have more control over my own destiny. I will be free to follow my own artistic vision and seek my own distribution, marketing and promotion partners that will help me bring my music to an international audience. The release of the album will be backed by extensive touring, supported by established booking agents in North America in Europe that have already expressed their belief in my potential.


…AND HOW YOU CAN HELP!

The recording budget I am seeking to raise with my campaign reflects my high aspirations. My first album should conform to the highest possible professional standards. Quality will lead to better results, both within the industry and from the public. An album is no easy task to undertake: with the funds I raise, I will hire professional musicians; I will record in Lane Gibson’s excellent studio in Charlotte, (VT) with top-notch gear; I will have my recordings mastered by a respected engineer, have it checked over and over again to make sure it’s flawless and ready for speakers big and small. I will work with photographers and designers who can help reflect my personality and music in visual terms.

It is easy to make a good album, but much more difficult to make a great album that rises above today’s information overload and stands the test of time. This is what I aim for with all of my artistic work. With your support, I can achieve my goal and make it count for the long term.

I hope to continue writing and performing for the rest of my life. With this opportunity to produce a full-length album of my own material, I will be taking one more step (a huge one, at that) towards making my musical aspirations real. With the help of those I love, those who love me, those I’ve met on my travels in this big world, friends of friends, strangers and avid music-lovers…with the help that people such as you are able and willing to offer, my music-making life will adopt a whole new momentum and begin its debut in the big pond. I look forward to jumping in with you.        : )

Merci a tous! 

Francesca Blanchard


To listen to more of my music, learn more about me, tour dates, etc.:

www.francescablanchard.com

www.facebook.com/francescablanchardmusic

www.francescablanchard.bandcamp.com

Sign up for my email list: http://eepurl.com/OnQOb

Boston University Media Team, Johns Hopkins Congdon II, Carl Heyerdahl, Erik Rojas & Chris Roewe
story_txt:
THANK YOU TO THE MOON AND BACK!! WE'VE MADE IT! NOW TIME FOR SOME STRETCHING. Or more icing : )Thanks to you, my campaign has reached its goal!!! I had no idea what to expect when I started this campaign less than a month ago, and I am so thankful for everyone’s support. Nearly 250 people have decided to help me record my first album. Some are family, others friends, members of my community, and many I don’t even know but felt generous enough to help me make music. It has been amazing to see how supportive everyone has been. I feel so inspired, excited and confident that you won't be disappointed in the final product : )Moreover, BECAUSE I've already accomplished my goal and still have two days left before the campaign ends, I'd like to offer some stretch goals. $25,000 will produce a beautiful album, but there’s more I’d like to do.If I am able to reach the following total amounts by midnight on the 28th, I will be able to do more and you can be rewarded for any additional support you can give. $27,000 --- I will be able to get professional press photos done. If I reach this goal, everyone who contributed $100 or more will get a signed print from the photo shoot.$30,000 --- I will be able to hire a professional graphic designer to design the artwork for the album. If I reach this goal, everyone who contributed $250 or more will get a custom lampshade from Chez Boheme, my mom's beautifully colorful antique store! (check it out here: www.chezboheme.com)$35,000 ---- I will be able to produce a music video for one of the songs on the album. If I reach this goal, every single person who contributed to the campaign will get one free Putumayo or Cumbancha CD…Visit www.putumayo.com andwww.cumbancha.com to see what they're all about.  If you're lucky, you'll get the Vintage France album, which features yours truly …     : ) Thanks again to all you have done so far, but let’s not let it end here. You can increase your contribution or convince someone new who has not yet contributed to help keep this train rolling until midnight strikes on August 28th (midnight in California…deadline is Pacific Standard Time).Merci! Merci! Merci!Francesca----------------------[ POUR LIRE TOUT CA EN FRANCAIS, APPUYEZ ICI! ]FRANCESCA WHO?If you’d asked me seventeen years ago what
I wanted to be when I grew up, I'd have answered, "archeologist!". Digging up
dinosaur bones seemed thrilling. Perhaps my four-year-old self sought to
discover and analyze ancient remnants of history; to study the
transcendence of all living creatures here on earth, or I just loved playing in the dirt (but I'd like to think it
was more romantic than that). Either way, four-year-old "Cheska" would never
have answered that she felt destined to become a singer-songwriter. She wouldn't have pictured herself playing a guitar, let alone being able to pick one up! She'd never have guessed that, somewhere down the road, her biggest dream
would be to sing songs that she’d written on her own - songs with words
and melodies she’d yearn to share with the people she loved and with the
world beyond.
My name is Francesca
Blanchard, and I am a singer-songwriter, working to fund my first,
full-length album. I was born and raised in France, with a French father
and an American mother. Being born into two cultures, my life has
consistently entailed a merging of these two identities. I grew
up as a French girl, and found my initial identity on the sandy beaches
off the Mediterranean coast. My father spoke to me
in French; my mother, in English. After moving to Vermont in 2002, maintaining my French identity became
difficult. Writing songs in the language, however, helped me preserve this
essential part of myself.

MY MUSICAt the age of fourteen, I learned to play
“Blackbird” on my mom’s Ovation guitar. I started taking lessons and
before I knew it, songs came out. I had stories to tell, feelings to
express, and mom’s guitar became the catalyst for my newfound
musical imagination.
My personal musical musings have led to a
rush of opportunities that seem to be saying my dreams of having a
successful career in music might not be fantasies at all. The response to
my music has exceeded my wildest expectations. In the past two years, I
have recorded a six-track EP, performed in Boston, London, Paris and
across VT. I've opened for Suzanne Vega and Caravan Palace, appeared at
the prestigious Francofolies Music Festival in Montreal and played at the Association for Performing Arts Presenters conference in NYC. I was featured on Putumayo's Vintage France collection and was a musical guest on numerous radio shows, including Vermont Public Radio. Interest
from promoters, labels and booking agents in North America and Europe has been steadily growing, and I am blessed with an ever-expanding group of fans and supporters.LISTEN TO MY DEMO OF "LE BLUES"LISTEN TO MY DEMO OF "TU N'EXISTES PAS"
MY PLAN
For the past two years I have been
gaining experience, composing and polishing new songs,
learning the ins and outs of the music business, recording demos and
finishing my college degree in Theatre Arts at Boston University. I am now
ready to take giant steps towards a life of music and performance.


The money I raise with this campaign will
be used to produce the best-quality album possible. I will be working
alongside Montreal-based producer/singer-songwriter Chris Velan, with whom I’ve
been in constant contact about my songs and the direction in which they should
be taken. With a self-financed album in hand, I will have more control over
my own destiny. I will be free to follow my own artistic vision and seek my
own distribution, marketing and promotion partners that will help me bring
my music to an international audience. The release of the album will be backed
by extensive touring, supported by established booking agents in North
America in Europe that have already expressed their belief in my
potential.
…AND HOW YOU CAN
HELP!

The recording budget I am seeking to raise
with my campaign reflects my high aspirations. My first album should
conform to the highest possible professional standards. Quality will lead
to better results, both within the industry and from the public. An album
is no easy task to undertake: with the funds I raise, I will hire
professional musicians; I will record in Lane Gibson’s excellent studio in
Charlotte, (VT) with top-notch gear; I will have my recordings mastered by
a respected engineer, have it checked over
and over again to make sure it’s
flawless and ready for speakers big and small. I will work
with photographers and designers who can help reflect my personality
and music in visual terms.
It is easy to make a good album, but much
more difficult to make a great album that rises above today’s information
overload and stands the test of time. This is what I aim for with all of
my artistic work. With your support, I can achieve my goal and make it
count for the long term.
I hope to continue writing and performing
for the rest of my life. With this opportunity to produce a full-length
album of my own material, I will be taking one more step (a huge one, at
that) towards making my musical aspirations real. With the help of those I
love, those who love me, those I’ve met on my travels in this big world, friends
of friends, strangers and avid music-lovers…with the help that people such
as you are able and willing to offer, my music-making life will adopt a
whole new momentum and begin its debut in the big pond. I look forward to
jumping in with you.        : )Merci a tous! Francesca BlanchardTo listen to more of my music, learn more about me, tour dates, etc.:www.francescablanchard.comwww.facebook.com/francescablanchardmusicwww.francescablanchard.bandcamp.comSign up for my email list: http://eepurl.com/OnQObvideo credits (respectively):Boston University Media Team, Johns Hopkins Congdon II, Carl Heyerdahl, Erik Rojas & Chris Roewe

story:
Project Alpha: Making olive harvesting easier.

Who we are

Agroworld by DI ZIO S.R.L. is a company in the start-up phase. Our business is about making a significant contribution to innovation within agricultural technology by the design, construction of Agricultural machines and products.

The general manager is 29 year old Luca Di Zio, who for 5 years has led the company with an inventive business outlook.

Making agricultural mechanization more accessable. particular we are focussing on agricultural tools that will make fruit harvesting easier.

What we would like to do: Our project Alpha

We want to manufacture and supply to farmers, an automatic tool capable of easily and efficiently harvesting olives for the production of Extra virgin olive oil. The tool consists of a double rake  with a pneumatically powered movement mounted on a telescopic pole, lightweight and quiet.

WHAT CAN ALPHA DO

1 Allow the the farmer to work safely from the ground without the need for ladders or hazardous tree climbing

2 Less physical effort required from the farmer compared to the manual method

3 Reduction of harvest time by up to 80% compared to the manual method



THE ALPHA PROTOTYPE

Alpha is light, quick and safe.

Results of the Alpha prototype

A prototype of the Alpha pneumatic rake has already been built and used to test and assess its functionality. The Alpha prototype was given to a farmer to be used for the harvesting of 1000 Olive trees (Olea europaea L.) which are the most common in the world.

We gave the possibility of using Alpha directly to the farmer plantation owner.

The result was surprising: Harvesting rates of approxiamately 80 - 90 kg of olives per hour were achieved with a total harvest of 80 000 Kg.

Harvesting rates of approxiamately 80-90 kg of olives hour were achieved with a total harvest of 80 000 Kg.



The Alpha harvesting rake principle of operation

Our goal is to manufacture a range of Alpha harvesting rakes to meet the needs of Olive producers.

The machine is composed of a fixed part, the body and a moving part, the comb. Mounted within the body is the mechanical drive system to move the comb. The mechanical drive system is operated using compressed air delivered from a simple compressor unit connected to the telescopic handle of the rake.

The unit using compressed air creates a fast reciprocating motion of the comb. When the comb is raked over the olive trees the fast reciprocating movement of the comb easily detaches the olives, causing them to fall on the ground to be subsequently collected. The rake does not damage the olives or the plant.

The movement of the rake acts directly on the olives, which, due to the profile of the teeth is able to collect all varieties of olives. The outer body is made from a particular hard plastic polymer, which has good heat dissapation properties preventing condensation and posible water freezing in low temperatures. The tool can oscillate at 2000 beats for minute. The maximum operating pressure is 7 bar. In total, the tool has a weight of 2 kg including the telescopic handle.

The rake is connected to a aluminium telescopic rod enabling olives to be picked from even the highest part of the tree. The rake has a working length of 3 metres.

The Alpha harvesting Comb: Production Cycle

All components that make up the Alpha will be constructed and assembled by ourselves.

Alpha consists of approximately 30 micro light components: fixed parts and moving parts that using compressed air drive the comb action.

The exact materials used is a secret but in general terms Alpha will be made from plastics (polymers) and metallic materials (aluminium alloys).

The following diagram summarizes the whole process of production.

Project Alpha timeline
May/june 2013: Alpha conception and design
August/september 2013: Construction of prototype
October/November 2013: Prototype testing on 1000 olive trees
November 2013: Olive oil and packaging
Today: impliment Crowdfunding
December 2014: Alpha production and world distribution

Overview of the Olive agricultural business

It has been estimated that the world has more than 850 million olive trees,  80% of which are located within the Mediterranean basin. Most global production comes from Southern Europe, North Africa and the Middle East.

Within European production, 70% comes from Spain, 20% from Italy and 10% in Greece.

lobally, the demand for olive oil has grown strongly in recent years and this product interests many consumers. Demand for olive oil and other related olive oil products is increasing.

The U.S. itself  has seen increased consumption of olive oil: there are those who want to use these meditranean products having discovered them on a trip to Europe. Or because the ever popular Mediterranean diet is seen as a way to experience a healthier lifestyle. A recent survey in California reported that about 3,000 farmers are now engaged in the cultivation of olive trees for the production of oil.

Many farmers in California, Mexico, Chile, Argentina and New Zealand are starting to require a more automatic means of harvesting as the trees first planted about 20 years ago begin the full production. Australia is witnessing the same situation.

Thousands of farmers around the world, would be able to benefit by using the alpha harvesting rake for the olive harvest.

How you can help

With a donation you can help us and become part of a major technological, social and rural project.

With this amount it would be possible to complete the whole project Alpha. If the total amount is not achieved the project would still go ahead in proportion to the amount given.

Contact

For further information please do not hesitate to contact us

Address any enquiries to: Luca Di Zio

email: info@project-alpha.info or dizioluca@tiscali.it

web: www.project-alpha.info

HELP WITH A SMALL DONATION AND  SET IN PLACE A GREAT PROJECT TO SUPPORT  TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPEMENT IN AGRICULTURE.

story:
San Lorenzo Makes an Album!



That's right folks! The artists formerly known as Doctor Stromberg and the Nurses have decided that 8 syllables is 4 too many and we're back on the scene with a new name and a new sound. About halfway through recording, we realized we are pretty good at trombone and not so good at budgeting. Here's what we need to make our record happen:

  • Your love and support
  • About $1,000

We know we can count on you, especially because we've come up with some pretty awesome perks

The Album

We're excited to be able to bring the tunes you've heard us play live to your living room! The album will feature all of our favorites including

Just Once

The Stillness

Relatively

Shade Below

Sore Eyes

Kintampo Road

and will be released in late November just in time for Thanksgiving! 

Stream our single for free here and get a sneak peek!: 

https://sanlorenzomusic.bandcamp.com/track/kintampo-road

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you also broke like us? We understand. You can still contribute to the San Lorenzo cause!

  • Get out there on the interwebs and in the real world and spread the word about our indiegogo campaign! 
  • Stream our single loudly on repeat until your neighbors tell you to turn down that infernal racket! All press is good press.
  • Print out the picture below and staple it to a t-shirt or sandwich board

Much Love,

San Lorenzo

story:
Short Summary

Hello, friends. We're Burdened Hearts. We're a small number of guys from various areas of Maryland who all share one heart and desire. The thing we want most in this world is to show it the love we believe it desperately needs. This love has forever changed our lives. This love is Jesus Christ. The name "Burdened Hearts" derives from not only the calling we're walking in, but the audience to whom we wish to reach. For a human being, - whether you've grown up in church all your life, whether you want nothing to do with a God, whether you're anywhere in-between - to say you have it all figured out and are living life perfectly and fully is a very bold and foolish claim. Every day we all fall short. More importantly: None of us are alone. What we aim to do is to be as real, and transparent as we can with all whom we encounter. Only through that humility can we really see and show how our God is "good all the time." This band is a ministry before it is anything else, and we'd have no desire to play if it weren't to bear witness to our King. With that said, we want to do our very best to reach as many as we can to simply show an unconditional love, and to use words only if necessary. That is what brings us here! We're currently preparing to head into the studio to record a full length album. Lyrically, we intend to be as transparent as we can. The album will tell a time from one of our members lives where he struggled deeply with his faith, falling away and back into all he'd known before hand, before getting back up and striving to grow spiritually and nearer to Christ. The album will give first person account of many areas of struggle that we all face, more specifically the ones we often don't tell anyone.

What We Need & What You Get

The overall cost for studio time is roughly $5,000, which includes two weeks of studio time for 12 songs to be fully recorded, mixed and mastered.

The reason we have the amount set to $6,000 is to cover the cost of providing all of what is included in the perks that you may choose from. This includes, graphic design, material costs, and shipping for all that can be potentially sent out, as well as potential cost for traveling (in the event that we're to play at your house, or drive you your perk package).

In the event that more than $6,000 is raised, extra money will go towards funding the touring we plan to begin following the albums release.

The Impact

The goal is to reach out to the world and spread the Gospel. If the words or music created for this chapter reach even one person, whether it be a seed planted to a life changed we consider all of the work put into it to be worth every second of our time spent and every ounce of our hearts given.

Risks & Challenges

We're a small group of guys with bills to pay and families to help provide for. We'll be putting literally all that we can into this process. We don't expect anyone to have to give; we ask that you contribute as you feel led. We're faithful that God will provide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends about our goal! Whether it be sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, or even with a close friend, or a sibling who will pretend to listen, we truly are thankful for your time spent checking us out. God bless!


All photo credit to Tyler Mazza.

story:
Our Purpose

Do you ever leave church feeling like you could have given more during Worship?

Do you ever feel like your Worshiping wrong?

Do you ever wonder what it truly means to Worship?

Well, you're not alone. We are RENOVATION WORSHIP and we too at some point in time asked the same questions. We took time and sat at the feet of God in prayer, and we finally understand the meaning of worship. We want to access the authentic power of Worship & Praise through song by remaining hungry for God’s presence. We are a duo, Marcus & Patience St.Julien, who came together as one to spread the gospel of Jesus Christ through our passion for music. 

With great HUMILITY, we ask for your help in jump starting our music ministry. There are various expenses that are needed in order to complete this unique project. We believe in providing an excellent product for you!

Our forthcoming project will be one that is unique by providing an experience no one has ever done before. Our plan is to lead worshipers through a worship experience for a complete year by releasing a Time Delayed EP. The concept is a vision placed on the heart of Marcus St. Julien, the visionary of RENOVATION WORSHIP, to innovate the way we experience Worship through Contemporary Christian Music. 


What We Need & How You Can Help

In order to carry out our vision we need YOUR support. Your contribution will allow us to release a 6 song Time Delayed EP in January of 2015 with the actual release date of each song happening every two months. By the end of the year you will have a full compilation of the EP. Funding will help us in the following areas:

  • Production (Piano, Guitar, Drums, etc...)
  • Recording (Vocals)
  • Mixing and Mastering 
  • Promotion
  • Advertising/PR

If we do not reach our goal during this campaign we will use the funds toward our first song with the same goals. We would continue to seek funding to complete the vision God has placed on our hearts.

Spread the Word

We understand that everyone will not be able to make a financial donation. However, you can still show your support by spreading the word about RENOVATION WORSHIP and our ministry. Tell your friends, who then can tell their friends and their friends, friends! Posting our campaign on your social media sites assists us with building our social media presence and that is equally as helpful, if not more helpful on this journey. 


FAQs


  • When will the album come out?

    We have not announced an exact release date as of yet but it will be announced at the end of this campaign, if we reach our goal.

  • How can I pay?

    Directly on Indiegogo through Paypal. If you want to transfer funds from your bank account you can connect a Paypal account to your bank account. Let us know if you need any help. 


Thank you so much!
story_txt:
Our Purpose 
Do you ever leave church feeling
like you could have given more during Worship?
Do you ever feel like your
Worshiping wrong?
Do you ever wonder what it truly
means to Worship?
Well, you're not alone. We are
RENOVATION WORSHIP and we too at some point in time asked the same questions. We took time and sat at the feet of God in prayer, and we finally understand the
meaning of worship. We want to access the authentic power of Worship & Praise through
song by remaining hungry for God’s presence. We are a duo, Marcus & Patience
St.Julien, who came together as one to spread the gospel of Jesus Christ
through our passion for music. 
With great HUMILITY, we ask for
your help in jump starting our music ministry. There are various expenses that are needed in order to
complete this unique project. We believe in
providing an excellent product for you!


Our forthcoming project will be
one that is unique by providing an experience no one has ever done before. Our plan is to lead worshipers through a worship experience for a complete year
by releasing a Time Delayed EP. The concept
is a vision placed on the heart of Marcus St. Julien, the visionary of

story:
#LetUsBreathe

After the shooting death of Mike Brown in Ferguson, MO, a group of poets, playwrights, educators, and activists in Chicago became deeply concerned about the police aggression toward peaceful protesters. They launched the #LetUsBreathe fundraising effort to bring tear gas protection, medical & hygiene supplies, nonperishable food, and water to Ferguson protesters.

When they arrived in Ferguson, though the tone of the protests had become more peaceful, there were still a determined group of young people camping out in the protest area who vowed to stay until an arrest was made. They are the Lost Voices.

#LetUsBreathe began documenting their stories and the evolution of the resistance in Ferguson. Unsatisfied with mainstream media's portrayal of youth of color and what has become the modern Civil Rights Movement, they began producing the Lost Voices documentary directed by award winning filmmaker Lonnie Edwards.

#LetUsBreathe has teamed up with Lost Voices to launch a tour of screenings, discussions, performances, and workshops that will start in Chicago and travel across the nation to bring a story of young people overcoming their differences to unite against police brutality, the criminalization of youth of color, and the intersections of institutionalized oppression. 


Justice Is Not a Spectator Sport

Lost Voices consists of 11-15 men and women whose campsite was constantly terrorized by the police presence in Ferguson. On Friday September 26, their fourth campsite was raided, two women were brutally arrested, one woman was put in a chokehold until she blacked out, and all of the tents and camp supplies were carted away in trucks. 

You can be involved by contributing to housing, transportation, and meal costs for these brave youth as they travel around the country with the Lost Voices documentary film. 

While some of our partner organizations will be able to help offset these costs, we recognize that the communities that most need the catalyzing dialogues provided by Lost Voices may not be able to afford hotel rooms for 15 people. Your contributions will allow us to offer this programming at low or no cost to schools, non-profit organizations, and community colleges that want to hear the real story of what's happening in Ferguson from the people who have been at ground zero since Day 1. 


    The Impact

    American education has taken the critical thinking out of the classroom in such a way that many teenagers of color are never equipped with the tools to dissect the causes of their circumstances. 

    In Chicago, we see the staggering effects of this - as after school programming, arts curricula, and youth employment opportunities are decimated by exploitive and myopic policies, Chicago's teenagers are being slaughtered by gun violence, arrested, and incarcerated at a rate that should make it clear that older generations have gravely failed in its stewardship of the youth. 

    But this is not a story unique to Chicago. Communities of color across the country feel the effects of opportunities being choked off while education squelches rather than cultivates the youth's ability to connect the dots and analyze why their communities are the way they are. 

    The Lost Voices have been catalyzed by the tragic death of Mike Brown, and have a message for young people across the globe: "Your beef with your neighbor is nothing compared to racism's beef with you. In order to defeat oppressive policies, your voice needs to be heard. Uniting instead of fighting is what we need to challenge the systems that create racist laws & economic inequity."

    Because Lost Voices consists of young people ages 15-35 who came together across gang sets, socioeconomic backgrounds, and neighborhoods to form a family united by the cause of justice for Mike Brown, they are in the unique position to speak to a generation the media would like you to believe is apathetic and disengaged. Lost Voices wants to bring its message to your city & your youth: Your voice is power & your lost voice can be found. 


    October 13

    12pm

    Justice for Mike Brown March

    7:30

    Lost Voices: A Ferguson Story

    documentary screening at the Logan Center
    915 E 60th Street
    Chicago, IL

    October 14
     10:30
    Native Son performance at Court Theater attended by youth from Lost Voices and Chicago's Juvenile Intervention and Support Center followed by post-play discussion with artistic team

    12:00pm
    Justice for Mike Brown Luncheon with Lost Voices and JISC youth at Court Theater to discuss the themes of Native Son, how they relate to current events in Ferguson, and what are next steps for youth community activist organizing

    October 28
    6pm
    Lost Voices hip-hop & spoken word feature at WordPlay
    Young Chicago Authors
    1180 N Milwaukee
    free

    October 29
    6pm
    Lost Voices: A Ferguson Story
    documentary screening, facilitated talkback, and strategy meeting with Black Youth Project 100
    Young Chicago Authors
    1180 N Milwaukee
    free

      Risks & Challenges

      The situation in Ferguson is still unfolding and is presently very tense. Ferguson police use frivolous arrests and brutality as a tactic to weaken the resistance. The Lost Voices have been targeted and the unpredictable nature of the situation on the ground makes it difficult to travel. That is why we need your help. As the demand for Lost Voices to share their stories around the country increases, the ease with which they can respond to those needs depends on reliable transportation, housing, and meals. Waiting on reimbursements from universities and non-profits is not realistic; we need your commitment to make their visit to communities across America as secure and safe as possible. 


        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you're concerned that there are more immediate needs in Ferguson that you could contribute to, here are some other ways to get involved:

        - Donate to the Legal Support Fund for Justice for Mike Brown. Protesters are being unjustly & frivolously arrested in large numbers every day. Make sure they are able to get back to work as quickly as possible.

        - Donate to Lost Voices. Contribute directly to the Lost Voices activities on the ground. This fundraiser only supports their activities on the road. 

        If you want to support in a way other than financial donations:

        - Connect us to a university, community organization, school, museum, or group that should see the Lost Voices documentary film & hear from Ferguson protesters face to face. Email LetUsBreathe2015 [at] gmail. 

        - Come to Ferguson for the Weekend of Resistance October 10-13

        - Follow @LostVoices14 on Twitter & Instagram  @LostVoices314

        - Share and RT posts related to Ferguson, social justice, and police brutality, especially information that the mainstream media is under-reporting.

        - Spark conversation - This is indeed the modern Civil Rights movement. Critical dialogue about what's going on in your home, workplace, church, classroom,  or even when you're alone in your car is necessary. The more minds we have on these issues, the quicker collective consciousness can be achieved. Just thinking and speaking are powerful tools!

story:
Historical background.

Nazca was formed in 1993 in the sunny Indian Ocean island of La Reunion.

They released their first EP “Reaching your soul” in 1997, which received positive press internationally for its quality and level.
It would not be until 2003 when the band would release its second effort, “The White Wheel”, a full length mixed by Dennis Ward (Pink Cream 69, Angra, Vanden Plas, Unisonic...), which saw Nazca take their sound to the next level. Sadly, the group went on hiatus the same year.

The new project.

In early 2012, the passion and motivation crept back into the lives of the members and the band reformed. It was during the regrouping that Nazca committed itself to writing a new album, which would see them working with the very talented Turkish producer, Cenk Eroglu, who has previously worked as a songwriter, guitarist, arranger and engineer with Winger, Pat Mastelotto, Richard Page... 

A beautiful artistic, and especially human adventure got on track!

The team, financing.

Nazca Association, in charge of the management of the group, was restructured in 2012, and its team of managers was expanded. It enables us to have the confidence of public authorities and makes us eligible for aids from Direction des Affaires Culturelles Océan Indien, Région Réunion and the City of Le Tampon. Enough to start the project but not to finance it completely, that's why we call on you today to finalize it. YOU are our last hope!

With a total of 25,000€ of 40,000€, Nazca still needs additional 20 days of studio... Also, graphic design of the new album and two trips to Turkey are still required. The success of this project may result in manufacturing, distribution and promotion of the album by a label as a result of very well advanced conatcts.

Studio sessions, concerts.

Work for the new album is being divided between Reunion Island and Istanbul. Recording sessions are scheduled for December 2014, and the first of 2015. With your help, a meeting with Safiko Productions, as well as a tour of India will take place in 2015. 

For you.

Thank you, our gratitude is sincere and profound to the measure of the passion that leads us and still animates us.

Music is our raison d'être.

story:
Short Summary

I've been recording from home since the signed band I was in crashed and burned. Specialising in a sort of Lo Fi Psychedelia I have been uploading my albums to my site for free download for the last 4 years. Now it's going to be my last gasp - I'm currently writing and recording a very "pop" orientated set that will be accessible without changing my whole musical ethos etc...I want to press the CDs and sell them online with some promotional clout - if this album doesn't work I'll retire PoM.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need the money to go towards mastering the recording, printing the artwork and pressing the discs.
  • I'll list all your names on the album credits
  • Any profit I make on the sales I'll send to the Down's Syndrome Association, although after the campaign I will be paying back the manufacturing costs on a monthly basis from my own pocket so that DSA will end up getting the full amount. I will keep all receipts of money spent and display them on my website along with all sales made. I will not make a penny from this - I just want to put the album out there

The Impact

  • Any profit I make on the sales I'll send to the Down's Syndrome Association. I will keep all receipts of money spent and display them on my website along with all sales made.

story:
Hey Hi Hello!


My name is Avalon Young and I'm a musician from San Diego and this music thing is my passion and the only thing I can see myself truly doing for the rest of my life.
I'm nineteen years old and I released my last EP "Drowning in You" almost exactly one year ago. It was a fully produced and mastered EP.
These next three songs that I'm trying to release will be all live acoustic studio versions of three, maybe four, new originals. 
In my campaign video box, I put my most recent original "Good Enough" so you can get a little taste of what my music is like. 
As much as I would love to get in the studio today right this very second and record it, I happen to also be a broke teenager!
Your help and support, whether it be donating or telling people about donating, would honestly mean the entire universe to me because this music is what I live for.
If you even took the time to read all of this, you're pretty rad.
Thanks so much! :)
-Avalon

story:
UPDATE!!!

  • Timo Somers and Sander Zoer of symphonic-metal band "DELAIN" will be collaborating and playing on the new album!

  • Barend Courbois (Blind Guardian/Vengeance) is joining forces on bass!

  • Cirque de Soleil and Riverdance score writer helping with orchestration!


***   PLEASE REMEMBER TO ADD SHIPPING TO YOUR PERK: $5 for North America and $15 for everywhere else. Thanks!!

*****    For those wondering about the $20 "Mega Download" - it does NOT include the brand new album (because it's not made yet!) but there is a separate $10 download perk for the new album!



Brand New Full-Length LEAH album

Most of you know me from my first full-length album "Of Earth & Angels" which I released in 2012. Others know me from the 5-song EP "Otherworld" which featured guest vocals from Testament's Eric Peterson. A few others know me from my YouTube covers, such as King Arthur's "We Will Go Home". If you've heard any of my music, you know it is my passion. You know my own celtic roots are very influential part of my songwriting, and I'm always working on something new.

I'm ready for the next project.


Being a Do-It-Yourself artist is both challenging and rewarding these days, especially when it comes to the financial end. I love the freedom, and being able to call my own shots, and I love that so many dedicated music-lovers want to bypass labels and the big corporations and support me directly! I can't tell you how much I appreciate that.

Having said all that -  one thing you really need in order to do anything (ie. produce a great-sounding album, print merch, tour, etc.) -- is funding. So while I continue to keep my family #1 priority (I'm a homeschool mom) I'm hoping you'll join me in this journey to the next musical project -- that is -- a FULL-LENGTH ALBUM!

Last time I was still just getting my name out there (and still am!) so I only raised enough funds to do a little bit. I worked with what I had and made a 5-song EP, which was mixed by Spacelab Studios (Delain, Serenity, Everon, Imperia). I believe this time around I have enough faithful listeners and friends that are willing to step up and be co-contributors to a real high-quality full-length album!

I feel more inspired than ever to write better music, always pushing and challenging myself.

Already, I have much material to sort through and refine, and in the process I usually end up writing even better songs and nix a few others (this always happens!). I've begun to flesh out a theme for the album content, the visualization (which will affect the photography and art), and more. I'm very excited about where this next album will take me - and you!

My main thing has been along the lines of symphonic rock/metal with Celtic and folk undertones or overtones. I will be staying along these lines, but always pushing forward. There will be some interesting players on this next one, and I think it will take me into new territory!


Thank you so much for reading, supporting and sharing this campaign with your friends and networks. That is really the only way I'll be able to do this!

* I'm going out on a limb here and choosing the "Fixed Funding" option. It's all or nothing baby! Either we raise all the funds needed or I get ZERO. BUT - if every fan on <<Facebook alone>> contributed ONE dollar -- we would easily surpass the funding goal by a long shot.

If you can only do one thing - please share with your entire social networks!
Need some ideas?

  • Email!
  • Facebook!
  • Twitter!
  • Blogs!
  • Youtube!
  • Music forums!

Thanks a million - I can't wait to get started!!!

XOXO,

LEAH

That is really the only way I'll be able to do this!* I'm going out on a limb here and choosing the "Fixed Funding" option. It's all or nothing baby! Either we raise all the funds needed or I get ZERO. BUT - if every fan on <<Facebook alone>> contributed ONE dollar -- we would easily surpass the funding goal by a long shot.If you can only do one thing - please share with your entire social networks! Need some ideas?
Email!
Facebook!
Twitter!
Blogs!
Youtube!
Music forums!
Thanks a million - I can't wait to get started!!! XOXO,LEAH

story:
Short Summary

Hello I am Jasyn. I make music under the name God Module.

It is coming up on two years since the last God Module CD "Séance" was released and I am deep into the creation of the new CD "False Face". We are shooting for a March 2014 release date for this album, and of course plans are already being made for a full US tour to support it. 

I decided to try a crowd funding campaign for this upcoming album and tour for the simple reason to make them better than what I can do on my own. Over the years I have met some awesome, talented and very passionate God Module fans and I think that together we can take these two projects far beyond what we have seen up to now.

This is not about making money in any way. Rather it is about having the funds to take both the new CD and the upcoming tour to a higher level for you to experience. When fans come to a God Mod show, I want them to have the same feeling that I had when I first went to a Skinny Puppy show from the "Too Dark Park" tour. I still remember how awesome it was -- the lights, the props, the backing videos; it all added so much to the music. 

What We Need & What You Get

Any funds raised with this campaign will go directly into the production, artwork, and mastering of the "False Face" album, as well as tour production. Touring is already expensive, even if you just show up and use the venue's potentially awful (if existing) lighting set-up. I don't want to have to rely on what the venue has. I want to be able to bring you God Module live the way it should be. We will use the money to create a custom light and visual stage show involving new horror props and stage decorations. On stage, I want to visually convey what I try to express in my music. I think by offering you guys some fucking awesome, one-of-a-kind perks when you contribute to this, we can do just that.

I am not asking you for a hand out here by any means. If you want to be super cool and donate money, that is awesome; however I want you guys to have a chance to get some things from this that you won't see every day. Among these are:

  • Stage banners from the Let's Go Dark, Triptych, and Empath 2.0 tours. 
  • Masks and claws I have worn on stage around the world. 
  • Three professionally created life size horror props that were used on the Seance tour.
  • Chances to get your name in the new CD. 
  • Exclusive t-shirts, signed CDs and posters.
  • A golden ticket that will get you into any God Module show in the world from now on etc.
  • Custom VillainX T-shirt design with your face.
  • And finally I am even offering my actual one-of-a-kind stage prop "Nubbins" the zombie -- who has been on my mic stand at hundreds of shows across the globe. All I ask is if you buy him you give him a good home. He has done a lot over the years and deserves some rest in his old age.

Obviously all of this is going to be expensive. Our goal is $3500 and I think we can do a lot of what I want with this. If we don't reach it then I will do my best with what we have to still make the album and tour as special for all of you as possible. If we go over the amount then not only will the CD and tour become bigger and better, but after we reach the goal I will be give everyone who contributes some exclusive bonus God Module merch. We will do this every time we go $1000 over the goal. The first perk will be announced if we get that far. 

The Impact

Even though this is our first "official" crowd funding campaign, you guys have been doing this since we started simply by buying our music, coming to shows, buying t-shirts, etc. Without your support, I would just be making music for my friends and putting on shows in the mirror for myself... and a grown man jumping around a room alone, wearing a mask, making weird faces and screaming songs might seem a little insane to some people. Fortunately, you guys let me do this onstage in front you and that makes it seem normal...kinda! :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

I don't expect everyone who reads this to be able to help us out financially. If you can't, there are still ways you can help make this a success. Share this page and what we are doing on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr etc. accounts. Tell your friends or anyone you know who likes what we do. There are share tools on this page that make it as simple as one click to get the word out. Any and all help is greatly appreciated!

story:
Jack and Misty-nearly homeless

IT'S NOT TOO LATE! YOU CAN STILL SEND ACHECK TO JACK AND MISTY AT THEIR POST OFFICE BOX, IT'S THE SAME ADDRESS TO ORDER A CD ON THEIR WEBSITE JACDKANDMISTY.COM. THEY STILL NEED FUNDS BADLY AND OUR CAMPAIGN FELL SHORT OF WHAT WAS ABSOLUTELY NEEDED! YOU CAN ALSO SEND MONEY DIRECTLY TO THEM THROUGH PAYPAL! THANK YOU! AND A BIG THANKS TO ALL WHO DONATED!

It's become a desperate plight for these jazz musicians turned country stars from the sixties and seventies. A developer bought the lovely land that that the Blanchard's rented when they bought a mobile home several years ago. This was where they were supposed to retire on their meager social security checks. They bought low, and lived on less than a thousand a month. Now they must move with no savings and no assistance from family. Here is their story;

" Had it not come to this, we might have convinced the world that we were doing fine for a couple who had some great and humorous hit records and appeared and performed on talk shows and the CMA awards in the seventies. 

Friends of ours heard of our devastating news when we, along with many of the tenants in this park received eviction notices. Our land was being developed so that multi-million dollar homes could be built. The land is currently being bulldozed, people are moving away and their trailer homes are being destroyed one by one. We can't afford to move the trailer and we have thirty days to vacate. For two folks in their seventies, we aren't physically able to move and we have no cash reserves to get a new place or to hire help. The park is under no obligation to offer moving assistance and has not committed to help.

Our lives have been turned upside down. After writing and performing hits like "Tennessee Bird Walk and Humphrey The Camel" our royalties and CD sales have dried up and our situation is currently dire. We are considering selling our small collection of memorabilia from our performances just to get into an apartment, however we have no means to move anything and have no storage area to take it to. It is heartbreaking to ask for help from our friends, our fans and others.

  • Your contributions will help us to get help relocating, finding a moving company and movers and to come up with security deposits and utility deposits. We otherwise have no options and with failing health can not do it ourselves." 


Friends of Jack and Misty ask for your help!


  • Ideally it would take $10,000 to pack, ship and relocate. If we can not secure help with that, then we will be forced to take our clothing and family treasures and leave our furniture behind hoping that some charity will help furnish an apartment we find. In this case, our belongings will be destroyed along with our home.
  • We have very few possessions in life but they are ours, and we have each other for which we are very grateful. Our greatest blessings are our friends, family and fans who have stood by us through the test of time.
  • Our stress level has been high with mostly sleepless nights and worry. Our daughter now has terminal cancer.  With our age and current housing crisis we are unable to be at her bedside in Salt Lake City. (Jack's health is declining and Misty is not well enough to even take an airline flight to see her daughter.)
  • Even if we don't reach our entire goal, we will be grateful for any help that is offered to us and will make do with what we have.
  • You will receive the satisfaction of knowing who you are helping and how. We will post updates on our Facebook.
  • We are grateful for your help.

The Impact

You will help us find another little place to call home, it doesn't need to be fancy or large, but it will bring amazing peace of mind to two retired folks who have loved to sing about chickens and camels for many years.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the word about this situation. Someone may have another mobile home available or perhaps they own a moving company. The more people come to know about this situation, perhaps they will know someone who can assist.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I'm a Canadian ex-pat who has lived in La Paz, Bolivia for over ten years.  I'm a hardworking full-time freelance wordsmith (you could describe me as being somewhat of a digital nomad) and a skilled life-long musician.

What I Need

I'm at a juncture where I am able to apply for permanent residency in the country that has been home for me for over a decade. However, I have over two years of fines that have accrued since my last 2 year residency visa expired. At approximately 3 dollars a day, I'm looking  at around $1,500 usd just in fines alone. Considering that there will be additional costs related to obtaining all of the necessary paperwork, and then the cost of the visa itself, I have set my goal at five thousand dollars. Having held various visas over the years, I know that there will be a lot of bureaucratic hoops to jump through with many unexpected expenses.Thankfully, this will be the last visa I need to get!

 

What I'm Offering

I'm offering two different music related products, and three different writing related services to those who are willing to part with their hard earned cash to help me with my goal.

For thirty bucks, you will receive  an instructional book I've written on the "Greatest Rock Guitar Riffs". There are 27 riffs in the book, each of which comes with a video, tabs, an explanation, as well as some interesting trivia. The book is also bilingual, written in both English and Spanish. Above there is an example of a video. Also, in this campaign's cover photo you can see a list of the guitar riffs that are covered in the book!

For ten dollars, You will be purchasing two of my albums.

For  eighty dollars I am offering one of three different writing services. These include a     Spanish<->English translation, audio transcription, and SEO website copy for businesses. In my capacity as a full-time freelance digital nomad, these are the three areas that I specialize in. 

 

After The Visa...Maybe Some New Musical Equipment?

I need to raise funds so I can take care of my permanent visa. This is my top priority and major financial obstacle at the moment.  No, this is not a medical emergency, nor is it the case that I'm trying to bankroll a serious technological innovation that is going to improve everyone's life. I simply need a leg up money-wise so I can normalize my visa status in Bolivia once and for all.

That's my primary goal, but I'll be completely honest; I'd like to make as much money as I possibly can. Who wouldn't? I'd love to be able to buy some much desired musical equipment, and my job as a writer, transcriber, and translator does not leave a lot of money left over to buy anything costly. I'm hoping that people will see the real value in the perks I'm offering, and I will be able to earn enough to buy some new gear. (I don't have any serious gear right now, The yellow guitar you see me playing in the videos was stolen by a taxi driver).

 

Meaningful, High-Quality Perks

I have something of real to value to offer with my campaign's various perks. If you're an advancing guitar player who's also learning Spanish, the 30 dollar E-Book is definitely a way to kill two birds with one stone. There are also hundreds of businesses and organizations who have benefited form my writing work; the 80 dollars spent will easily pay for itself in time saved and exposure gained. 

Please take the time to review these perks that I am offering. In the descriptions of each you will find links to examples of my writing work, my guitar playing, and my group's music. 

Please feel free to message me directly should you have any question about this campaign and what I am offering. 

Thanks to everyone who has read up to this point,

Daniel Lebofsky

PS. Any social shares of this campaign would be greatly appreciated
